Natividad wants to increase her income so she can afford to finish construction on their house.  She would like to be able to leave the home to her children, as a symbol of her hard work and dedication.

loans.use: to stock her small store with rice, sugar, milk and other popular items.

loans.name: Joffre Alexon Rivadeneira Garcia

texts.es:
JOFFRE ALEXON, de 62 años de edad, es casado, tiene siete hijos, vive  con su esposa e hijos,  en el Recinto San Joaquín del cantón Montalvo, Provincia de Los Ríos.

La VRC  San Joaquín  se   encuentra a 15  minutos  de la oficina Montalvo, está conformada por 12 socios.

 JOFFRE ALEXON se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de arroz, soya y cacao, con la obtención de este crédito piensa incrementar su negocio y mejorar las siembras  ya que invertirá en la compra de  insumos,una bomba de riego lo que facilitará el trabajo.

Las compras y ventas las realiza en la ciudad de Montalvo de manera semanal.

El sueño es comprar una camioneta, para comercializar los productos de manera segura. Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan  son las pérdidas de los cultivos, especialmente por plagas o estación invernal constante.  
Su tiempo libre lo dedica a la lectura.
texts.en:
Joffre Alexon is 62 years old, is married, and has seven children.  He lives with his wife and children in Recinto San Joaquín, which is located in Montalvo canton in the province of Los Ríos.  He belongs to the San Joaquín Communal Bank, which is situated 15 minutes from the Montalvo office and is made up of 12 members.

Joffre Alexon makes a living as a farmer.  He specializes in growing rice, soy, and cacao.  He goes to the city of Montalvo every week to purchase supplies and sell his produce.  

This loan will allow him to increase his business and improve his crops, since he plans to invest it in inputs, including an irrigation pump that will make his work a lot easier.

Joffre Alexon’s dream is to purchase a van so he can sell his produce more easily.  His main challenge is crop loss, especially due to pests or a prolonged dry season.  In his free time he enjoys reading.

loans.use: to purchase an irrigation pump for his farm.

loans.name: María Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora  María Lourdes es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, desde hace muchos años se dedica a la actividad de docencia donde tiene mucha experiencia en este ramo en la enseñanza a los niños lo que le da gran valor por aportar un granito de arena para el futuro de Nicaragua.

Es madre soltera de dos hijos los cuales ha formado exitosamente ya que son personas de bien al igual que ella. 

Actualmente, está solicitando su segundo crédito para seguir mejorando su vivienda el cual será invertido en la compra de cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para embaldosar toda la vivienda con el fin de tener mejores condiciones de vida para ella y sus hijos, lo que viene a mejorar su calidad de vida gracias a la ayuda de estos créditos que solo por medio de ellos se pueden cumplir los sueños de los clientes.
texts.en:
María Lourdes is a native of the city of El Sauce. For many years she has earned her living as a teacher. She has a lot of experience teaching children and she values the fact that through her work she has contributed "a grain of sand" toward Nicaragua's future. 

She is a single mother of two sons. She has raised them successfully; they are good people like their mother.

She is currently requesting her second loan in order to continue improving her home. She will invest the loan in the purchase of cement and sand and in the payment of laborers to tile the entire house. Her aim is to allow herself and her sons to live in better conditions, which will improve their quality of life, thanks to the help these loans offer. Only through these loans can María Lourdes and the other clients of Kiva's partner fulfill their dreams.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand and pay laborers.

loans.name: Celia Diocelina

texts.es:
Celia es una mujer alegre, trabajadora, responsable con sus hijos. Celia vive con su esposo y sus hijos en las afueras de la ciudad de Ambato que se encuentra en la Provincia de Tungurahua.

Celia trabaja con su esposo en la agricultura, especificamente en la siembra de papas, con las ganancias de este negocio utilizan para los gastos de su hogar y estudios de sus hijos. Es el tercer crédito que realiza en Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser utilizado en la compra de semilla de papa y para la compra de abonos fungicidas para que tengan un buen producto.

Celia sueña en comprarse un terreno.
texts.en:
Celia is a cheerful, hardworking woman who is responsible with her children.  She lives with her husband and children in the outskirts of the city of Ambato located in Tungurahua Province.

Celia works with her husband in agriculture, specifically farming potatoes.  They use profits from this business to cover household expenses and their children’s education costs.  This is the third Fodemi loan and it will be used to buy potato seeds ant to buy manure and fertilizer in order to obtain good product.

Celia dreams with buying a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds, manure and fungicide.

loans.name: Delfina De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Delfina es una mujer de 37 años, se describe como una persona alegre, trabajadora y muy responsable en sus actividades. Delfina vive con su esposo y sus cinco hijos en las afueras de la ciudad de Ambato en la Provincia de Tungurahua.

Delfina trabaja sola en la crianza de cuyes o conejillos de Indias, es el tercer crédito que realiza en Fodemi el mismo que va a ser utilizado en la la ampliación del galpón de sus cuyes y para la compra de crías de cuyes para crianza, engorde y reproducción que ayudará a incrementar su negocio, sus ventas e ingresos los mismos que servirán para sustentar los gastos y estudios de sus hijos.

Delfina sueña con que le sigan ayudando para poder prosperar con su familia.
texts.en:
Delfina is a 37 year old woman who describes herself as cheerful, hardworking and very responsible with her activities.  Delfina lives with her husband and five children in the outskirts of the city of Ambato in Tungurahua Province.

Delfina works alone raising guinea pigs.  This is the third loan she’s gotten from Fodemi and she will use it to expand the guinea pig enclosures and to buy litters of guinea pigs to raise, fatten up and breed so that her business will increase and thus her sales and income which will serve to cover expenses and her children’s educational costs.

Delfina dreams that she will continue to be helped so that she can prosper with her family.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs to raise and to improve the guinea pig enclosures.

loans.name: Maria Amparo

texts.es:
María, se dedica a las actividades agrícolas, vive con su esposo quien es agricultor, tiene 4 hijos de 23, 18, 12, y 11 años de edad, todos son dependientes; María apoya a su esposo en las labores agrícolas y en la crianza de cerdos, trabajando junto  a sus hijos, su ventaja en que poseen sus propias tierras en las que trabajan.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de 3 cerdos, esto le ayudara para mejorar y aumentar su granja, teniendo más oportunidad de crecimiento en el negocio, el riesgo en este negocio es la posibilidad de enfermarse los cerdos o la variación en los precios.
El objetivo de María es incrementar el negocio, sus ingresos, para darles a sus hijos mejores oportunidades de superación, velando por su salud, educación y alimentación.
texts.en: Maria works in agriculture.  She lives with her husband who also works in agriculture.  They have four children together, ages 23, 18, 12 and 11, and all of them still depend on their parents.  Maria helps her husband with their business raising pigs on their small piece of land.   They work together with their children.  Maria is requesting a loan to purchase 3 more pigs.  This will help them grow their business, which is always vulnerable to price changes or one of the animals getting sick.   Maria would like to increase her income, so that she can give her children better opportunities,  provide them with good health care, food and education.

loans.use: to purchase 3 pigs.

loans.name: Lorna Tirado

texts.en:
Lorna is 56 years old and married. She has 4 children. Lorna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25000 loan, through NWTF, to purchase more stock to sell.

Lorna has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane, electonics re-loading, rice and feeds retailing, and selling nipa palm.

Lorna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Karen Jane

texts.en:
Karen Jane is from Upper Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga del sur. She is 23 years old. Karen Jane is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Karen Jane owns & operates a "sari-sari" or general store. Karen Jane has been engaged in her business for a year and earns 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Karen Jane joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Karen Jane is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to obtain daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to obtain daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 40 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort portal region of Uganda. She is widowed and has 3 children. For the past 5 years, Beatrice has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Beatrice has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities and will help Beatrice to generate greater profits and increase her stock. Beatrice hopes that, in the future, she will be able to expand her business and get increased profit. 

Beatrice is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Beatrice who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities.

loans.name: Blenda

texts.en:
Blenda is 46 years old and married. She has two children. She earns a living in the Philippines by farming vegetables and raising livestock. Blenda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Blenda has been farming vegetables for 5 years and also earning the additional income from livestock. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Yawo

texts.fr:
Yawo est un homme âgé de quarante-sept ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse. Il a trois enfants, dont deux sont encore à l’école. Le premier a dix-neuf ans et le dernier a dix  ans.  
Il travaille comme machiniste et revendeur depuis 1992. Il vend des matériaux de construction pour toutes personnes dans sa boutique. 
Yawo a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des matériaux de constructions et d`ameublement. Il veut utiliser ses profits supplémentaires pour assurer les biens de sa maison et de prendre bien soin de ses enfants. 
Dans les prochaines années, Yawo voudrait avoir plus de matériaux dans son magasin pour mieux satisfaire ses clients. Il dit qu’avec des profits, il prévoit d`améliorer la condition de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yawo is a 47-year-old man who is married to a retailer. He has three children, of whom two are still in school. The first child is 19 years old, and the last is 6. Yawo has been working as a machinist and a retailer since 1992. He sells construction supplies to anyone at his store. 

Yawo has requested his first loan from WAGES for buying some construction supplies and furnishings. He wants to use his extra profits for furnishings in his home and for taking care of his children. 

In the next few years, Yawo would like to have more supplies in his store to satisfy his customers further. He says he will use the profits to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Reserita

texts.en:
Reserita is 42 years old and has 6 children. She is married and 2 of her children are in school.

Reserita is in the agricultural business in the Philippines, farming vegetables. Reserita has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming vegetables for 22 years now and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Reserita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ma. Eda

texts.en:
Ma. Eda is 47 years old and has 6 children. Ma. Eda is married and 3 of her children are in school. Ma. Eda is in the agricultural business farming vegetable and raising livestock in the Philippines. Ma. Eda has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for vegetable planting, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ma. Eda has been farming vegetables and raising livestock for 30 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for vegetable planting, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Donna

texts.en: This time, for her 10th cycle loan, Donna is borrowing PHP 19,000 to fund her farming vegetables. This agricultural business was previously funded through NWTF. KIVA continues to provide her and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is a married woman who has four children. Rosenda is 33 years old, resides at San Carlos, Tukuran, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. 

Rosenda owns & operates a business selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community to earn her living. She's been in this business for 12 years. Each month, she earns 2,000.00 PHP doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 5,000.00 PHP to buy more fish to sell. Rosenda has  been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, she wants to build a house and to fund the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Now, Remedios is borrowing PHP 29,500, with which she intends to buy ingredients for her business making fermented fish. This business was previously funded through KIVA partner, NWTF. This loan will allow her to continue to provide her family with income that is improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making her fermented fish.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes forma parte del Banco comunal “Unidos Emprendemos  con Esperanza”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Curicó.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente vendiendo ropa usada y también preparando alfajores. 
Trabaja con la venta de ropa, desde hace 5 años, sin embargo la producción de alfajores es desde hace 6 meses.
Su mercadería específicamente la ropa la compra directamente a familiares y conocidos, respecto a los ingredientes para la preparación de alfajores, los compra en una distribuidora.
Sus clientes son particulares, por lo que vende sus preparaciones de alfajores desde su casa, por otro lado también vende a los almacenes aledaños en el sector donde vive. Y los fines de semana, trabaja en una feria libre vendiendo ropa.
Comenta que la temporada de más alta demanda de los alfajores, es a partir del mes de abril en adelante. 
Con el crédito comprará bolsas de ropa e ingredientes para sus preparaciones de alfajores. 
Una de sus metas es construir un local estable al interior de su casa. Y posteriormente incorporar solo venta de ropa nueva.
Mercedes vive junto a su marido y su hijo de 21 años de edad, quien estudia en la Universidad, la carrera de Ingeniería en Informática. Uno de sus proyectos personales es realizar algún curso de perfeccionamiento, que le sea útil a su negocio.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de Fondo esperanza, ya que el préstamo le permitirá invertir en su negocio. El grupo del cual forma parte es muy comprometido. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones del Banco comunal, comenta que le han permitido aprender nuevas estrategias de contabilidad e inversión.
Curicó se ubica en la región del Maule, zona centro del país. El clima de Curicó es de tipo mediterráneo y es considerado como uno de los más agradables del país. Se caracteriza además por su cultura en torno al vino y sus alrededores de belleza natural.  A pesar de que la fuerza de trabajo se ha  incrementado, esta zona sigue siendo, según el último censo, una de las más pobres del país.
texts.en:
Mercedes is part of the “Unidos Emprendemos con Esperanza” (United We Enterprise with Hope) communal bank belonging to the city of Curicó.

She is a merchant, specifically sells used clothes and also makes “alfajores” [sponge cakes].  She’s been selling clothes for five years but has been making the sponge cakes for the last six months.  She buys the clothes directly from family members and acquaintances and the ingredients for the alfajores from a supplier.

Her customers are individuals so she sells the alfajores at home but also sells to nearby stores.  On the weekend she sells the clothes at a free street market.  She comments that the high season for the alfajores starts in April and goes on from there.  She will use the loan to buy bags of clothes and ingredients to make the alfajores.  One of her goals is to build a stable locale inside her house and later on sell only new clothes.

Mercedes lives with her husband and 21 year old son who is attending university studying computer sciences.  One of her personal goals is to take an improvement course that will help her with her business. 

She is very happy and grateful with Fondo Esperanza because the loan will allow her to invest in her business.  The group she belongs to is very committed.  With respect to the training delivered during the communal bank meetings she comments that it has allowed her to learn new bookkeeping and investment strategies.

Curicó is located in the Maule Region in the center of the country.  Curicó's climate is Mediterranean and considered to be one of the most pleasant in the country.  It’s noted for its winemaking culture and for the natural beauty of its surroundings.  Despite increase in employment, the zone continues to be, according to the latest census, one of the country’s poorest.

loans.use: to buy bags of clothes and ingredients to make sponge cake.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion is from Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 42 years old. Concepcion is married and has seven children. Concepcion used her last loan to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets. Her business has grown up and become successful. Now, she's taking a new loan to repair her fishing boat. Positively, she hopes to be able to further grow up her business.

loans.use: to repair a fishing boat.

loans.name: Nelly Doronila

texts.en:
Nelly, a 72-year-old widowed mother of ten, works hard to provide for her family. For 12 years she has run a general store in the Philippines, and also earns an income from raising hogs. Having borrowed and repaid 17 previous loans from NWTF, Nelly is requesting a new one for PHP 25000 to buy more goods to sell in her store.

Nelly aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Beatrice Mbambu

texts.en:
Beatrice is 37 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort portal region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, 3 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Beatrice has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Beatrice has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities, and will help Beatrice to generate greater profits and increase her capital. Beatrice hopes that, in the future, she will be able to expand her business and earn enough profit. 

Beatrice is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Beatrice who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities.

loans.name: Analyn Pelayo

texts.en:
Analyn is 31 years old and married.. With all of her 4 children in school, Analyn works very hard to provide for them. Analyn runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan, through NWTF, to buy items to sell in her store.

Analyn has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, sack foods, soft-drinks and other groceries. In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Clarita Pelayo

texts.en:
Clarita is 46 years old, married, and has 5 children. She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines, raising pigs. Clarita has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and to repair the fence for her pigs.

Clarita has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past, from NWTF, to sustain her business. In the future, Clarita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and to repair the fence for her pigs.

loans.name: Ziyad

texts.en:
Ziyad is a 37-year-old married man and the father of one child. He has worked as a butcher for 18 years. He's a man with a good reputation, loved by most of his customers because of his good customer service and the quality of his products. Ziyad works hard to improve his living and his business at the same time.

Ziyad is well known in the region because, compared to others, his shop is clean, his prices are affordable and his meat is tasty, as his clients say. He is an Al Majmoua borrower. His previous loan was invested in buying sheep, raising them and then selling their meat. Today, Ziyad is applying for a loan for the same purpose which reflects positively on his social and financial situations.

Ziyad is a borrower in good standing with Al Majmoua, and hopes to remain with the program. He hopes to expand his business and cover all of his family's expenses as much as he can.

loans.use: To buy sheep to raise and then sell their meat.

loans.name: Lina Golisao

texts.en:
Lina is 45 years old and married. She has 4 children who are currently going to school. Lina works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Lina has been running her business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other miscellaneous items. In the future, Lina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Musale Mbusa

texts.en:
Musale is 32 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort portal region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children who are currently in school. 

For the past 3 years, Musale has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. To help expand his business, Musale has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. This loan will be used to buy more essential commodities, and will help Musale to generate greater profits and increase his capital. Musale hopes that, in the future, he will be able to expand business. 

Musale is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Musale who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities.

loans.name: Lourdesita Brigoli

texts.en:
Lourdesita works hard to support her family. Lourdesita is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Lourdesita has been in this business for 9 years. In the future, Lourdesita would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Jose Modesto

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, él es propietario de un taxi, en el cual ofrece sus servicios desde hace 18 años, esto le ha ayudado a mantener a su hogar, su historia inicia como motorista de taxi, como trabajador, pero luego paso a adquirir su propio vehículo con línea de taxi para trabajar en lo propio.
El solicita un préstamo para el pago de la reparación del taxi, pagando el mecánico y la compra de repuestos, esto le ayudara para dejar el taxi en buen estado, ofrecer a sus clientes un viaje más seguro, y sacar adelante a sus hijos con los viajes que realice.
El objetivo de él es tener la posibilidad de obtener otros vehículos donde ofrecer una línea de servicio de taxi, pues le dará una mejor solvencia y capacidad para apoyar a sus hijos y poder verlos graduados como profesionales.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his wife and three children. He owns a taxi, which he has used to offer his services for the past eighteen years. His taxi has helped him to provide for his home. He began working as a taxi driver, as a worker, and then later purchased his own vehicle with a taxi service to work for himself. 
He is requesting a loan to cover repair costs for his taxi, to pay the mechanic and to purchase replacement parts. This will help him to have the taxi in running order, to offer his customers a safer ride, and to provide for his children through his work providing rides.
His objective is to have the possibility to obtain other vehicles from a taxi service, which will give him better financial solvency and the ability to support his children. He would like to be able to see them earn professional degrees.

loans.use: to cover repair costs for his taxi, to pay the mechanic and to purchase replacement parts.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa Montes Villalobos

texts.es: Blanca Rosa, tiene la edad  de 59 años, está viuda,  vive con sus dos hijos  actualmente. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar insumos como abono, herbicidas, foliares, para el mantenimiento del café  y así poder obtener el máximo de  producción de la plantación de café  y con ello poder  obtener más ganancias  para obtener una mejor calidad de vida y la de sus hijos y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Blanca Rosa, a widow, is 59 years old and currently lives with her two sons. With this loan she will buy consumable supplies, such as fertilizers and herbicides, for the maintenance of coffee plants. In this way she will be able to maximize her production of coffee and her earnings, and by doing so, she will be able to gain economic stability and improve quality of life for herself and her sons. This is the first loan she has received from Kiva's partner,  FUDECOSUR. She  has not been able to obtain loans from the state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided her with a loan with better terms and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy consumable supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Menihaha Mancao

texts.en:
Menihaha is 50 years old and married. She has 5 children. With 1 child in school, Menihaha works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

Menihaha has been in the sari-sari business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent, shampoo, and other miscellaneous items. In the future, Menihaha would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 50 years old and has 6 children. She is married and has 6 children who are in school.

Susan is in the agricultural business  in the Philippines, raising pigs. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Susan has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business operations. In the future, Susan would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Teresa Tautu-An

texts.en:
Teresa is married and has 6 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Teresa is 48 years old and 3 of her children are in school.

Teresa has a jeepney transport business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her jeepney. Teresa has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Teresa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her jeepney.

loans.name: Ann Camilo

texts.en:
Ann is 48 years old. She is married and has 2 children. Ann works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items for her store. Ann has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Ann would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari sari store, like shampoo.

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Rubelyn works hard to support her family. She has a rope making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her sari sari store. Rubelyn is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy materials for her rope making business.

Rubelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rope making business.

loans.name: Mariyln

texts.en:
This is Marilyn, 48, a resident of Bacoor Cavite, Philippines and a mother to her children. Her husband, Norberto, is a driver.  She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Marilyn oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. She has one (14-16 person capacity) jeepney, The driver remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 800 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP25, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marilyn dreams to have another vehicle in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 

-Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Rosario Quiapo

texts.en:
Rosario is 46 years old and married. She has 6 children.

She earns a living  in the Philippines by raising pigs. Rosario is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Rosario has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from clothing sales.

Rosario is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Hogbonouto

texts.fr:
Hogbonoute est une femme âgée de soixante-trois ans. Elle est veuve. Elle a quatre enfants, dont un encore à l’école. Le premier a quarante-et-un ans et le dernier a dix-sept ans.  
Elle travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1985. Elle vend des légumes, paniers, et des claies dans sa boutique.
Hogbonoute a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des légumes, paniers, et claies. Elle veut utiliser ses profits supplémentaires pour supporter ses petits enfants. 
Dans les prochaines années, Hogbonoute voudrait satisfaire le besoin de toute sa famille, et en plus que son plus jeune enfant élève puisse évoluer pour un lendemain meilleur.
texts.en:
Hogbonoute is a 63-year-old woman who is a widow. She has four children, of whom one is in school. The first child is 42 years old, and the last is 17. She has been working as a retailer since 1985. She sells vegetables, baskets, and sieves in her store. 

Hogbonoute has requested her first loan from WAGES for buying some vegetables, baskets, and sieves. She wants to use her extra profits to support her grandchildren. 

In the next few yeas, Hogbonoute would like to meet the needs of her entire family, in addition to her youngest child, a student, who may then work for a better tomorrow.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and sieves

loans.name: Soila Betsabe Bombon Muzo

texts.es:
Soila tiene 52 años, se describe como una persona alegre, trabajadora y responsable con sus hijos. Soila vive con su esposo y sus cinco hijos en la ciudad de Ambato que se encuentra en la Provincia de Imbabura.

Soila tiene una tienda de víveres, le ayudan sus hijos y su esposo ya que es la única fuente de ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar, es por eso que constantemente necesita proveer a su negocio de productos, es el tercer crédito que realiza a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de víveres al por mayor como quintales de arroz, azúcar, sal, papas, también productos enlatados, refrescos, entre otros lo que le permitirá a sus clientes tener más variedad y así podrá obtener buenos ingresos y mejorarán su calidad de vida.

Soila sueña con que le sigan apoyando con créditos para poder seguir adelante y mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Solia is 52 years old. She describes herself as happy, hard-working and responsible with her children. Solia lives with her husband and their five children in the city of Ambato located in the province of Imbabura.

Solia has a grocery store. Her children and husband help since it is the only source of income for covering the household expenses. For this reason, she constantly needs to supply her store with products. This is her third loan with Fodemi. The loan will be invested in the purchase of wholesale groceries like 100 pound bags of rice, sugar, salt and potatoes as well as canned goods, soft drinks and other things that will allow her customers to have more variety. By doing this, she will be able to obtain good earnings and improve her quality of life.

Solia dreams that they will continue to support her with loans, so that she can continue to move forward and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: purchase wholesale groceries like 100 pound bags of rice, sugar, salt and potatoes as well as canned goods and soft drinks.

loans.name: Escolastica

texts.en:
Escolastica works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rope making business in the Philippines. Escolastica has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her rope making business.

Escolastica has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from hog raising. In the future, Escolastica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rope making business.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Ablavi est une femme âgée de quarante-deux ans. Elle est mariée à un jardinier. Elle a cinq enfants, dont quatre sont à l’école. Le premier a vingt-sept ans et le dernier a quatre ans.  
Ablavi travaille comme jardinière et revendeuse depuis 1997. Elle fait le maraîchage pour tous sur un terrain. Elle travaille avec quatre personnes. 
Ablavi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits du culture de maraîchage. 
Dans les prochaines années, Ablavi voudrait encore un autre terrain pour sa culture ainsi qu`une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit satisfaire sa famille et ils vivraient en parfaite harmonie.
texts.en:
Ablavi is a 42-year-old woman who is married to a gardener. She has five children, of whom four are in school. The first child is 27 years old, and the last is 4. Ablavi has been working as a gardener and a retailer since 1997. She has a market garden for growing anything on a plot of land. 

Ablavi has requested her first loan from WAGES for buying some market garden produce. 

In the next few years, she would like to have more land for her crops, as well as a store. She says she will use the profits to support her family members, so they may they live in perfect harmony.

loans.use: to buy produce from market farms

loans.name: Exaltaciona

texts.es:
Exaltaciona es una mujer de 42 años de edad, conviviente, tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad no dependientes. Tiene su domicilio en el distrito de Mórrope. La mayoría de los habitantes de su zona son trabajadores independientes dedicados a la crianza y venta de animales pequeños, como también a la agricultura.
La actividad que realiza Exaltaciona es la crianza y venta de animales pequeños, los cuales al alcanzar el peso y talla ideal, son vendidos en el mercado local. Su esposo también colabora con el hogar y realiza trabajos de agricultura. Exaltaciona cuenta con experiencia de 10 años en la venta de animales.
El préstamo, ascendiente a 1000 nuevos soles, se destinará a la compra de alimento para sus animales y en la adquisición de ganado ovino y caprino para que se reproduzcan y vuelvan a dar cría, que luego se venderá a su crecimiento.
texts.en:
Exaltaciona is a 42 year old woman who lives with her husband. She has 2 grown sons; she has no dependents now. She has a home in the Mórrope district. Most of the inhabitants of her area are independent workers who earn their livings raising and selling small animals or raising crops. 

Exaltaciona's business is raising and selling small animals. She gets them to the ideal weight and size and then sells them at the local market. Her husband helps her with the household and works in agriculture. Exaltaciona boasts 10 years of experience in the sale of animals.

The loan of 1000 Peruvian nuevos soles (PEN) will be invested in the purchase of feed for her animals and the acquisition of sheep and goats to breed, so that Exaltaciona can then raise and sell the resulting offspring.

loans.use: To buy more livestock and feed for her animals.

loans.name: Julieta Esdrelon

texts.en:
Julieta is 61 years old. She is married and has 7 children.  Julieta works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Julieta has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending and internet cafe.  Julieta aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr:
Afiwa est une femme âgée de cinquante-un ans. Elle est mariée à un infirmier. Elle a trois enfants, dont deux sont à l’école. Le premier a vingt-cinq ans et le dernier dix-huit ans.  
La cliente travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1993. Elle vend les alimentations générale et du charbon de bois pour ses clients à sa maison. Elle a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d'améliorer le commerce(en achetant plus de marchandises). Avec ses profits supplémentaires, elle voudrait acheter un terrain. 
Dans les prochaines années, Afiwa voudrait achever l`avancement et la récréation des autres boutiques. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit une condition de vie améliorée.
texts.en:
Afiwa is a 51-year-old woman who is married to a health care worker. She has three children, of whom two are in school. The first child is 25 years old, and the last is 18. 

This client has been working as a retailer since 1003, She sells grocery items and charcoal out of her house. 

She has requested her first loan from WAGES for improving her business (by buying more merchandise). With the extra profits, she would like to buy a plot of land. 

In the next few years, AFiwa would like to be successful promoting and creating more stores. She says that she will use the profits for better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Paola Andrea

texts.es:
Paola es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy luchadora y siempre buscar salir adelante junto con hijo. Paola hace aproximadamente 2 años se encontraba trabajando en un taller de elaboración de piñatas, avisos en poliestireno expandido, entre otros productos más, y debido a que su jefe abandonó el municipio, le dejó la clientela que atendía para que ella la siga satisfaciendo. Es por esto que decidió montar su propio taller de elaboración de productos en poliestireno expandido donde ofrece una gran variedad de productos, pero su producto más vendido son las piñatas de cumpleaños. Paola gracias a este trabajo, ha podido salir adelante como madre soltera cabeza de familia, pues tiene un hijo de 3 años a quien su padre nunca ha aportado ninguna ayuda. Debido a que su taller lo montó con muy bajo capital, Paola no cuenta con todas las herramientas de trabajo necesarias, es por esto que busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de un compresor con aerógrafo para pintar sus productos con mayor calidad.
Paola de esta manera podrá ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor calidad en sus productos, por lo que aumentará sus ventas considerablemente. Además, Paola espera que con su taller mejor dotado de las herramientas necesarias, pueda ser más atractivo para nuevos clientes y pueda así sacarlo adelante. Paola sueña con tener un gran taller y con que su hijo pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida y el acceso a una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Paola is a person who is characterized by being a fighter and is always looking to get ahead with her son. About two years ago, she was working in a shop making piñatas, advertisements on expanded polystyrene, and other products.  Since her boss left the city, he left her the clientele that he attended to she could keep serving them.  This is why she decided to start her own shop making products on expanded polystyrene, and she offers a big variety of products.  Her most-sold product is birthday piñatas.  Thanks to this job, Paola has been able to get ahead as a single mother and head of the family.  She has a 3-year-old son whose father has never supported him with any help.  Since she started her business with very little capital, Paola doesn't have all of the necessary tools to do her job.  This is why she is looking for a loan that will offer her the possibility of buying a compressor with an airbrush so she can paint her products with better quality.

In this way, Paola will be able to offer her customers a better quality in her products, which will increase her sales considerably.  Additionally, Paola hopes to equip her store with the necessary tools so it can be more attractive for new customers so she can progress with her business.  Paola dreams about having a big shop so her son can have a better quality of life and access to a quality education.

loans.use: to buy a compressor with an airbrush to paint her products with better quality.

loans.name: Lenilia Borromeo

texts.en:
Lenilia is 54 years old.  She is married and has 3 children.  Lenilia works hard to provide for her family.  She sells nipa (woven palm mats use for house construction and repair) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of nipa to sell.

Lenilia has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been selling nipa for 14 years and also earns an income from selling charcoal.  Lenilia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more nipa to sell

loans.name: Lodely

texts.en:
As a married parent of 2 children, Lodely works hard to support her family.  She has a computer games business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Lodely is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for maintenance for her computer games  business.

Lodely has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for maintenance

loans.name: Goussivi

texts.fr:
Goussivi est une femme âgée de cinquante-deux ans. Elle est mariée à un photographe. Elle a quatre enfants, tous sont encore à l’école. Le premier a dix-huit ans et le dernier huit ans.  
La cliente travaille comme revendeuse de bazins (tissu Sénégalais) depuis 2002. Elle vend des bazins et des produits de mercerie pour ses clients dans un quartier de Lomé.
Elle a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des bazins pour élargir son stock. Si possible, elle veut utiliser ses profits supplémentaires pour élargir l`activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Goussivi voudrait vendre des pagnes aussi que des bazins. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d`aider ses enfants à aller encore plus l`école en leur trouvant un répétiteur
texts.en:
Goussivi is a 52-year-old woman who is married to a photographer. She has four children, all still in school. The first child is 18 years old, and the last is 8. 

This client has been working as a retailer of damask cloth (Senegalese fabric) since 2002. She sells damask and sewing supplies to her customers in a district in Lomé. 

She has requested her first loan from WAGES for buying some damask cloth in order to expand her inventory. If possible, she wants to use her extra profits for expanding her business. 

In the next few years, Goussivi would like to sell <i>pagnes<i/> (colorful West African cloth), as well as damask. She say she will use the profits to help her children with more schooling by finding a tutor for them.

loans.use: to buy damask cloth and sewing supplies

loans.name: Paulette Héloïse

texts.fr: Paulette Héloïse est mariée et mère de 3 enfants avec 38 ans d'âge . Elle a une baraque dans laquelle elle vend de la nourriture principalement la sauce graine . Elle a nécessité  un financement auprès de Finadev en vue de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle constitués de conducteurs de taxi-motos qui représentent la majorité de la populations aussi pour mieux rentabiliser son profit et d'améliorer sa condition de vie.
texts.en: Paulette Héloïse, aged 38, is a married mother of three children. She has a stand in which she sells food, mainly sauces made from seeds or beans. She needed financing from Finadev with the aim of satisfying the demands of her customers, who are composed of <i>moto<i/> taxi drivers who represent the majority of the population. Her aim is also to make her business more profitable and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of palm nuts and 2 sacks of corn

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila, is married and has 2 children. She is 32 years old, and resides at Tinotongan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Mila owns a plot of land where she raises crops for their living.  She's been 5 years in this business.  Each month, she earns 3,000 doing this type of business.

She requested a loan of 15,000PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops. In 2011, Mila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Mila wants to make improvements of her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Isabel Ruiz Chavez

texts.es:
Isabel es una mujer de 49 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en casa propia en el sector de Laynas, a 10 minutos de La Matanza, con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Isabel destaca por ser una cliente seria y muy respetuosa.
Como en la gran parte del norte del Perú, Isabel es una mujer que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chicha de jora, especialmente en el sector de Laynas.
El préstamo asciende a 1008 nuevos soles, el cual solicita para invertirlo en su negocio, específicamente para la compra de maíz duro y para la compra de accesorios para la venta de la chicha, tales como jarras, ollas, baldes , entre otros, para que de esa manera tenga mejores ingresos y por ende una mejor condición de vida en la jurisdicción.
El mercado es bueno para este tipo de negocio, ya que en su mayoría los pobladores exclusivamente las amas de casa son las que tienen este tipo de negocio, para ello necesita invertir y de esa manera perciba buenas utilidades.
texts.en:
Isabel is a 49 year old married woman. She has three sons. She lives in her own house in the Laynas sector, 10 minutes from La Matanza. She has good personal and work references. Isabel stands out as a serious and very respectful client of Kiva's partner. 

Isabel earns her living making and selling a popular beverage known as chicha de jora, a common activity in most of northern Perú, especially in the Laynas sector. 

Isabel's loan is 1008 Peruvian nuevos soles (PEN). She is requesting the loan in order to invest it in her business, specifically in the purchase of hard corn and accessories for the sale of the chicha such as jars, pans and buckets, among other items. In this way she will improve her earnings and as a result, achieve better quality of life. 

The market is good for this type of business. Many of the housewives of the area make their living in this type of business. To do so, it is necessary to invest in order to earn good profits.

loans.use: to buy supplies and raw materials for the preparation of chicha, a popular beverage.

loans.name: Ejido De Mayorazgo Group

texts.es:
El grupo "Ejido de Mayorazgo" esta conformado por tres mujeres y dos hombres todas son personas muy trabajadoras y responsables el nombre lo eligieron porque asi se llama el lugar donde viven, la comunidda es muy tranquila cuenta con todos los servicios com escuelas, centro de salud, luz, drenaje, agua potable etc. En fin todos los vecinos de la locacidad tienen acceso a los servicios.
Don Federico quien es el representante del grupo cuenta que tiene 38 años de edad esta casado desde hace 17 años con sus esposa Alejandra juntos han procreado 4 niños 3 de ellos son los que aun estudian, Alexa de 3 años, Jonatahan de 8 años se encuentra en primaria, Ivan de 15 años se encuentra en secundaria.
Don Federico se dedica a la crianza de borregos  desde hace 15 años comenta que la actviadad la inicio porque la aprendio de su papa esta vez ha solicitado el credito para comprar 5 borregos y lo que e quede sera para pastura, maiz y alimento.
Nos comenta que una de sus dificultades mas grandes es cuando no tiene el recurso necesario para comprar alimento y don Federico cree que es una de las razones por las cuales sus borregos se enferman cuando esto le sucede a don Federico tiene que comprar desparacitantes y vaitaminas para aplicarselos a borregos que tiene en casa.
"A mi el credito me va a benefiar de mucho porque podre comprar maiz que mucha falta le hace ya que este año pues casi no se levanto la cosecha del maiz"
Esta vez la meta de Don Federico es seguir creciendo la actividad tener mas borregos y de buena caliadad para que las ganacias sean cada vez mejores y asi mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia. Don Federico y el resto del grupo estan muy agradecidos con el credito otorgado ya que podran invertir en sus respectivas actividades. Maria Elidia, Josefina y Carolina invertiran en borregos mientras que Don Jose otro integrante del grupo comprara Pollos.
texts.en:
The group, "Ejido de Mayorazgo," is made up of three women and two men, all of whom are hard-working and responsible people.  They chose their name because of the place where they live.  The community is peaceful and has all services like schools, a health center, electricity, drainage, potable water, etc.  All of the people in the area have access to these services.

Federico is the representative of the group.  He is 38 and has been married to his wife, Alejandra, for 17 years.  Together they have 4 children, 3 of whom are in school.  Alexa is 3, Jonathan is 8 and in elementary school, and Ivan is 15 and in high school.

Federico has made a living raising sheep for more 15 years.  He tells us that he started this business because he learned it from his father.  He has requested a loan to buy 5 lambs, and he will use the rest to buy fodder, corn, and feed.

He tells us that one of his biggest difficulties is when he doesn't have the necessary resources to buy feed. Federico believes that this is one of the reasons his sheep get sick, and when this happens, Federico has to buy anti-parasitics and vitamins to apply to the sheep. 

He says, "The loan is going to benefit me a lot because I will be able to buy corn.  I need this because this year the corn harvest wasn't very good."

This time, Federico's goal is to keep growing his business to have more sheep that are good quality so his profits will get better and he can improve his family's quality of life.  Federico and the rest of the group are very thankful for the loan that is being offered to them so they can invest it in their respective activivities.  Maria Elidia, Josefina, and Carolina will invest in their sheep while Jose will invest in chickens.

loans.use: to buy sheep and feed.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is a 35-year-old married woman and mother of two children. Wafaa has owned a beauty salon since 2010 and has 16 years of experience in this field.  Wafaa is a hardworking woman.  She puts a great effort into helping her husband to make their living.

She has been an Al Majmoua borrower for two cycles.  Her previous loan helped a lot in buying necessary tools and machines for her business. Today, Wafaa is applying for an Al Majmoua-Kiva partner loan in order to take care of necessary maintenance to the salon's door & to increase her stock of beauty cosmetics that she uses and sells to customers.  Wafaa hopes to start an additional business that has to deal with sleeping clothes and underwear, in the future.

loans.use: To do the necessary maintenance of the salon's door & to increase stock of beauty products

loans.name: Francisca Garpa

texts.en: Francisca is 53 years old and is married.  She has 5 children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Francisca is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pig.  Francisca has been raising pigs for 3 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pig

loans.name: Cyril

texts.en:
This is Cyril, 43, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rogelio, a vendor, and she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and her children’s studies.  Cyril operates a market stall in the community market. She sells vegetables and other items to cook.  She buys a quantity of vegetables and other common items used in cooking and sells them by the kilo or per piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php8, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of vegetables and condiments to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Cyril dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.  There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Finafa Virginie

texts.fr: Finafa Virginie est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle commercialise des divers. En vue d'achalander son stock et d'avoir un grand nombre de profit. Elle a sollicité un financement auprès de Finadev pour subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et surtout des enfants.
texts.en: Finafa Virginie is 38 years old and a married mother of three children. She markets a variety of goods. With the aim of stocking up and having larger profits, she is requesting financing from Finadev to meet her day-to-day needs and especially those of her children.

loans.use: to buy containers of ointment, perfumes, and hair straightener

loans.name: Lomela Gomez

texts.en:
Lomela is 50 years old and is married.  She has 3 children who are in school.  Lomela is in the agricultural business, fattening  pigs.  Lomela requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.  Lomela has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lomela would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additioanl feed for her pigs

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela works hard to support her family.  She is married, and sells dried fish in the Philippines.  Angela requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.  Angela has been in this business for 10 years now.  In the future, Angela would like to save enough to provide secure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Crisanta Alcosaba

texts.en:
Crisanta is 50 years old and is married.  She has 3 children.  Crisanta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Crisanta has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from buying and selling copra.  Crisanta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Monbereola

texts.fr: Monbéréola est mariée, âgée de 62 ans et mère de 05 enfants. Elle commercialise des glacieres,des ustensiles de cuisine et des chaussures en plus de bijoux. Elle a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev  pour améliorer la qualité de ses ustensils afin de fidéliser la clientèle et participer au bonheur de sa famille.
texts.en: Monbéréola, aged 62, is the mother of five children. She markets insulated containers (coolers), kitchen utensils, shoes, and jewelry too. She obtained financing from Finadev for improving the quality of her utensils in order to earn the loyalty of her customers and to contribute to her family's happiness.

loans.use: to buy 2 sets of nested bowls, 3 sets of insulated containers, and a dozen shoes

loans.name: Dasa Hj Sali

texts.en:
Dasa is married and has 6 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  Dasa is 46 years old, and has 3 children who are in school.

Dasa grows vegetables in the Philippines. Dasa requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase seeds and to pay for laborer's salaries on her vegetable farm.  Dasa has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Dasa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and pay for laborers' salaries on her vegetable farm

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines.

Emma requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell in the wet market.

Emma has been in this business for ten years now.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Ester requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her business. She has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Ester would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie is 39 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Girlie works very hard to provide for them.

Girlie runs a business buying and selling copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production) in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Girlie has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Girlie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Jose Ezequias

texts.es:
José, esta motivado por un nuevo préstamo, pues continua el plan de mejorar la vivienda, reconstruyendo el techo, para eso necesita la comprar tejas, madera, lamina, polines, que son los necesarios para instalar nuevamente el techo, con este préstamo su vivienda estará en mejores condiciones para albergar a su familia.
El préstamo anterior tambien lo invirtió en la vivienda, por lo que a través de préstamos está mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: José is motivated to get a new loan, because he continues with the plan to improve his house by re-building the roof, for this he needs to buy tile, wood, metal sheets, studs, that are necessary to install a new roof, with this loan his house will be in better conditions to accommodate his family.  The previous loan was also invested in his house, so through loans he is improving his quality of life and his family's.

loans.use: to buy tile, wood, metal sheets, studs.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 50-year-old married woman with four children, ages 10, 15, 20, and 24. Her husband works as a farmer and carpenter.

Erlinda has been involved in farming for twenty-one years. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Erlinda and her husband work together to sustain their family. 

Erlinda requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds. She hopes that her income will enable her to sustain her children's education and improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is a 28-year-old married man. He has a son who is two years old. He describes himself to be honest and obedient. 

He operates a retail store where he sells cakes and doughnuts. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a densely populated busy town and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of ingredients. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy an oven. His business goal is to run a bakery within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have stable income.

loans.use: to purchase an oven.

loans.name: Mayra Magaly

texts.es:
Mayra está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque  considera  que de esta manera lograra salir adelante con su negocio, ella comprara maíz, aceite, gas, repollo, chicharrón y refrescos, para mantener lo necesario para atender a los clientes.
El préstamo anterior le permitió tener mayor capacidad para atender la demanda y también generar mayor ingreso para cubrir las necesidades.
texts.en: Mayra is requesting a new loan because she considers that this way she will be able to get ahead with her business, she will buy corn, oil, gas, cabbage, cracklings and soft drinks to have everything she needs to serve her clients.  The previous loan allowed her to have more capacity to serve the demand and generate more income to cover her needs.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, gas, cabbage, cracklings and soft drinks.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 15 años, en todo este tiempo ella ha podido aprender como ser mejor madre y ser mejor negociante, ella se dedica la venta de Flores y hace arreglos florales, esta muy satisfecha porque con las capacitaciones le ayudan a como tratar al cliente y ahora  después de 15 años sigue firme y progresando. Ahora con el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en al compra de flores.
texts.en: Julia is a member of the Agua Viva (Living Water) Communal Bank. She has been a member of Finca Peru for 15 years, and during all this time she has been able to learn how to be a good mother and a better retailer. She sells flowers and she also makes floral arrangements. She is very pleased because the seminars help her to better tend to her customers, and now after 15 years she carries on steady and she keeps on growing. The loan she is currently requesting will be used to buy more flowers.

loans.use: To buy flowers.

loans.name: Everlides

texts.es: Everlides de 43 años de edad,es una mujer casada que tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 13 y 15 años, con los que sueña ver convertidos en adultos exitosos; ella se dedica a la fabricación de calzado, actividad aprendida desde hace 17 años, de su esposo,  a quien ayudaba  los fines de semanas, pues los días hábiles, se encontraba trabajado como empleada, de una organización gubernamental en su departamento. En esa época Everlides, generó un mercado entre compañeras de trabajo y gradualmente fue extendiéndose;  cuando dejo de ser empleada y se dedicó a apoyar la microempresa familiar, logró el fortalecimiento de sus ventas por docenas a pequeños comerciantes y a empleadas de otras empresas. En la actualidad en esta microempresa trabajan ella, su esposo y una empleada y no tiene una máquina guarnecedora, por eso debe terciarizar el servicio y pagar un poco más por esta tarea. Su meta es lograr ampliar su negocio, mejorar su proceso productivo y aumentar el volumen de compras,  para obtener descuentos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará una máquina guarnecedora y el saldo lo invertirá en plantillas, cuero y pegante, para hacer nuevos diseños y ofrecerlos al mercado, en el que cumplirá su exigencia de modernidad, justificando así el ´éxito de esta inversión.
texts.en:
Everlides is 43 years old. She is married and has two children ages 13 and 15, and her dream is to see them become successful adults. She makes shoes, an occupation she learned 17 years ago from her husband, whom she helped on weekends, as on weekdays she worked an an employee of a government organization in her region.

At that time, Everlides created a market among her co-workers, and it gradually expanded. When she stopped being an employee she worked helping in the family small business, and succeeded in building up their sales, which they do by the dozen, to small merchants and to employees of other companies. 

Currently, she, her husband, and one employee work in the business, and they don't have an industrial sewing machine. That's why they have to outsource the service, and pay a bit more for this job.

Her goal is to succeed in expanding their business, improve their production process, and increase the volume of their purchases in order to get discounts. 

This is why why she is applying for her credikiva loan, her first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy an industrial sewing machine, and invest the balance in insoles, leather and glue, in order to make new designs and market them. This way she will meet her requirement for modernity,  justifying in this way the investment.

loans.use: To buy an industrial sewing machine, and invest the balance in insoles, leather and glue.

loans.name: Evergista

texts.en:
Evergista is 46 years old.  She is a married woman and has three children, ages 16, 17, and 20. Evergista is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She grows rice crops to sell. She earns about 5,000 PHP per month doing this farming. Evergista's husband is also a farmer.

Evergista requested a loan to purchase farm fertilizers. She hopes for her business to grow, which would help improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizers.

loans.name: Jonathan Muli

texts.en:
Jonathan is a 49-year-old married man. He has six children, ranging in age from 11 year to 30 years old. He describes himself as a visionary and determined man. 

Jonathan operates a retail stall where he sells clothes such as t-shirts, trousers, and jackets. He has been involved in this business for two years and employs one staff member. His business is located in a conducive business environment and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate funds for improving his business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes for selling. His business goal is to run another clothes retail store within five years.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. He is 58 years old, married, and has 10 children. 

Leonardo plants rice crops on his land and sells his harvest at the market. He also owns a sari-sari (variety) store that his wife manages. Leonardo works hard to sustain his family. He requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell, such as canned goods and toiletries. He hopes to expand his rice farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell, such as canned goods and toiletries.

loans.name: Erlinda Balilihan

texts.en:
Erlinda lives in Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental.  She is married and has seven children. 

Erlinda sells home-use products in her little store so as to support her family's daily basic needs. For seven years, she has continually managed her store and she earns PHP 5,000 a month from this. Since 2007, Erlinda has been a member of GDMPC. Now she needs to obtain more products to sell, so she took a loan of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC.. She is hoping for business progress and expansion.

loans.use: to obtain more products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, skirts, blouses and underwear.

loans.name: Tiburciana

texts.es: Tiburciana es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva, continua con la venta de anticuchos, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 7 años, con Finca Perú aprendió a ser mas responsable y no dejarse vencer por la dificultades, trabaja sola y trata que a su familia no le falte nada, gracias a los préstamos recibidos pudo ayudarles a sus hijos con sus estudios, y ahora sigue trabajado para que todo le salga bien. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de carne y papa.
texts.en: Tiburciana is a member of the Agua Viva (Living Water) Communal Bank . She continues selling anticuchos (grilled meat on a stick), and she has been a member of Finca Peru for 7 years. Thanks to Finca Peru she has learned how to be more responsible and not to be discouraged by difficulties. She works alone and she tries to provide everything for her family so that they find themselves not in need. Thanks to the loans she has received she has been able to pay for the education of her children, and she now keeps on working so that everything goes well for her. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy meat and potatoes.

loans.use: To buy meat and potatoes.

loans.name: Eduardo José Medina Gonzalez

texts.es: Eduardo  con su credikiva anterior compró al por mayor accesorios y repuestos de teléfonos celulares, que vendió y ganó dinero con esta venta. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el que comprará más repuestos y accesorios de teléfonos celulares en mayor volumen, los cuales importará directamente de la China. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Es muy noble la labor que desarrollan de apoyar en todo el mundo a pequeños empresarios que solo necesitan un préstamo para salir adelante con sus familias. “
texts.en: With his last 'credikiva' (loan from Kiva), Eduardo purchased at wholesale cell phone accessories and replacement parts which he then sold, earning money from the sale. At present, he is applying for another Kiva loan, with which he will buy more cell phone parts and accessories in larger volume, that he will import directly from China. His message to Kiva investors is the following: "You are doing very noble work to help small entreprenuers all over the world who just need a loan to advance their families!"

loans.use: purchase more replacement parts and cellular phone accessories in larger volume.

loans.name: Haylen

texts.en:
Haylen is married and has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Haylen is 26 years old and has one child who is in school.

Haylen has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Haylen has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Yabo Adjikè Nicole

texts.fr: Agée de 45 ans, Nicole est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle a un emplacement ou elle vend des beignets de l'igname frite auxquels elle associe le commerce de tissus et amuse-gueule. Elle a sollicité un financement auprès de Finadev en vue d'accroître son stock et de maximiser son profit pour le bonheur de la famille.
texts.en: Nicole is 45 years old, married and the mother of three. She has a stand where she sells yam fritters. In addition, she sells cloth and snacks. She is seeking a loan from Finadev in order to expand her stock and maximize her revenues, to improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy one  bag of yams, one  basket of beans,10  pieces of cloth, two bunches of bananas

loans.name: Doris Xiomara

texts.es:
Doris solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar más productos para la tienda como productos enlatados, aceite, embutidos, pollo, condimentos, esto le permitirá ofrecer a los clientes variedad de producto para mantener la preferencia de ellos.
Con el préstamo anterior logro comprar mercadería surtir el negocio aumentar las ganancias, actualmente su familia se encuentra estable.
texts.en: Doris requests a new loan to buy more products for her store such as canned products, oil, sausages, chicken and spices, this will allow her to offer her clients a variety of products to keep them preferring her business.  With the previous loan she was able to buy merchandise and stock the business to increase her profit, currently her family is in a stable condition.

loans.use: to buy canned products, oil, sausages, chicken and spices.

loans.name: Marcela Ivania

texts.es:
Marcela, desea invertir más en el negocio ya que las ventas han aumentado y tiene la oportunidad para aumentar sus ganancias solicita el préstamo para la compra de quesillo, maíz, chicharrón, aceite, con los que espera mejorar la producción.
El negocio de marcela a mejorado debido a la inversión del préstamo anterior  creciendo poco a poco y estabilizando su condición familiar.
texts.en:
Marcela wants to invest more in her business because sales have grown and she has the opportunity to increase her income so she requests a loan to buy cheese, corn, cracklings and oil with which she hopes to have better production.
Marcela's business is better due to the previous loan investment growing little by little and stabilizing her family's condition.

loans.use: to buy cheese, corn, cracklings and oil.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva, se dedica a la venta de cereales y verduras, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 2 años, lo que mas valora es el ahorro y gracias a ello, ahora sus hijos terminaron de estudiar, Paulina trabaja mucho y trata de hacer bien las cosa y de invertir bien para que su negocio pueda progresar. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de verduras y cereales.
texts.en: Paulina is a member of the Agua Viva (Living Water) Communal Bank. She sells cereals and vegetables. She has been a member of Finca Peru for 2 years, and what she mostly values are the savings, thanks to which her children have been able to complete their studies. Paulina works hard and she tries to make things right and to make good investments so that her activity can grow. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of vegetables and cereals.

loans.use: To buy cereals and vegetables.

loans.name: Katherine

texts.es: Katherine de 25 años,  es una joven casada que tiene un hijo en la edad de 4 años. Ella se desempeña en una actividad, generadora de ingresos, como lo es la decoración y elaboración de productos con sus propias manos en material foamy, además de vender fantasías e insumos para trabajar con artesanías.
