de terres tomates poivres piments...) qu'elle va revendre au détails au niveau du petit marché de son village.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de participer aux besoins alimentaires de sa famille.
texts.en:
The Darou Salam Taku Liguey group is currently made up of 11 women, and was created during the first cycle of the "banc villageois". It groups together women from the same village who share common social values.

Ndéye Coumba, standing on the far left of the photo, is the group's leader. She is 54 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She is also responsible for 3 more. She is a small retailer and sells vegetables and condiments. She has good experience in her area of work which she has been in for nearly 30 years. She will use her part of the loan (190 000 francs) to buy some merchandise (onions, cabbage, potatoes, tomatoes, peppers, etc) which she will resell to retail customers at her small village market. The profits from her business will allow her to contribute to her family's food needs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and condiments.

loans.name: Taku Liguey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Taku liguey  composé de 11 membres a été crée depuis le premier cycle du BV .

Il regroupe des femmes du même village ayant de valeurs sociales communes et s'activant toutes dans le petit 

commerce .

Sa responsable madame Fatime est une femme mariée âgée de 61 ans, elle n'a pas d'enfants mais on lui a confié 3 qui sont à sa charge.

Fatime,  debout à l’extrême gauche de la photo fait du petit commerce par la vente de couscous, une activité 

qu'elle pratique depuis bientôt une dizaine d'années, c'est pourquoi elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.

Son nouveau crédit de 90000 XOF lui permettra de payer 8 sacs de mil pour en faire du couscous qu'elle 

va revendre dans son village.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de payer la nourriture pour les enfants qui lui sont confiés, 

mais également de faire des épargnes au niveau du Banc Villageois.
texts.en: The Taku liguey group of 11 members was created at the same time as the BV (Banc Villageois). It comprises women from the same village who share common social values, all of whom are small retail traders. The group leader Fatime is a 61 year old married women, she has no children of her own but cares for 3 who have been entrusted to her. Fatime, standing on the far left in the photograph, is a small retailer selling couscous, a business she has conducted for almost ten years - this is why she has a lot of experience in this activity. Her new loan of 90,000 XOF will allow her to buy 8 sacks of millet, to make couscous with, which she will sell in her village. The profits from her business will allow her to buy food for the children in her care, but also to have some savings with the the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to purchase millet for preparing couscous to sell

loans.name: Balla Camara Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 12 juin 2008. Il  est  constitué de 09 femmes qui habitent le même village. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.
Madame Josephine qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 27 ans. Elle est célibataire et mère de 03 enfants. Elle s’active dans la restauration, avec une buvette. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu’elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.
Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.
Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en: The community group was created on 12th June 2008. It comprises 9 women who live in the same village. Their main activity is small retail trading. Josephine, who is on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the group leader. She is 27 years old, single and the mother of 3 children. She runs a restaurant with a small bar. She has good experience in this activity, having worked in it for several years. This loan will allow her to increase her working capital and to better develop her business. The profits will allow her to improve the family's living conditions (health, food, clothing, etc) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her bar-restaurant

loans.name: Sope Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé le 10 Février 2012. IL est composé de 13 femmes issues de différents quartiers. Elles se sont constituées par affinité, par voisinage. La plus part d'entre elles sont des parents elles ont comme activité le petit commerce. 

Faty est responsable du groupe, elle est debout à droite sur la photo. Elle est âgée de 41 ans et à en charge une petite fille. 

Elle a pour activité principale le petit commerce d'habits, de tissus et produits cosmétiques. Elle dispose d'une petite cantine devant chez elle où elle développe son activité qu'elle mène depuis plusieurs années. 

Son prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en marchandises pour satisfaire sa clientèle. 

Son objectif est de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille sur le plan scolaire, sanitaire et de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en: The group was formed on the 10th February 2012. It comprises 13 women from different areas. They came together through friendship and proximity. Most of them are parents, and are small retail traders. Faty is the group leader, she is standing on the right in the photo. She is 41 years old and is responsible for a small girl. Her main activity is the trading of outfits, fabrics and cosmetic products. She has a small stall in front of her home where she conducts her business, as she has been doing for several years. This loan will allow her to buy more stock to meet her customers' wants. Her goal is to be able to meet the family's financial needs in schooling and healthcare, and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, outfits and cosmetic products

loans.name: Yayamane Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 12 juin 2008. Il  est  constitué de 13 femmes qui habitent le même village. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Angélique qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge 02 autres enfants confiés par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans l'élevage et la vente de porcs. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu’elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  son activité.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
The community group was created on the 12th June 2008. It comprises 13 women who live in the same village. Their main business is trading activity. Angélique, who is on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the group leader. She is 37 years old. She is married and the mother of 6 children. She also has 2 other children in her care, who have been entrusted to her by her parents. 
She is a pig farmer. She has good experience in this activity, which she has been doing for several years. This loan will allow her to increase her working capital and to better develop her business. The profits will allow her to improve the family's living conditions (health, food, clothing etc) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for resale

loans.name: Diambar Jiguén Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Diambar Jiguén qui compte actuellement 9 membres a été crée depuis le cycle du banc villageois.

Il regroupe des femmes du même village, ayant de valeurs sociales communes et s'activant toutes dans le petit commerce. 

Madame Nogoye responsable de ce groupe est une femme mariée âgée de 47 ans et mère de 3 enfants et 3 autres qui lui sont confiés.

Nogoye (debout à l’extrême gauche de la photo) a comme activité principale le petit commerce de légumes.

Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans son domaine d'intervention pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis bientôt 20 ans.

Son nouveau crédit de 170.000 XOF  lui permettra de se procurer de la marchandises( pommes de terres 

,oignons,choux,tomates ...) qu'elle va revendre au niveau du petit marché de son village.

Les bénéfices générés par son activité lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la gestion des dépenses 

quotidienne  de la famille.
texts.en: The Diambar Jiguén group, which currently has 9 members, was formed at the same time as the banc villegeois. It comprises women from the same village with common social values; all of them are small retail traders. Nogoye, the leader of this group, is a 47 year old married woman; she is the mother of 3 children and in addition cares for 3 others. Nogoye (standing on the far left of the photo) is principally a vegetable trader. She has a lot of experience, having done this for almost 20 years. Her new loan of 170,000 XOF will allow her to buy stock (potatoes, onions, cabbages, tomatoes...) which she will re-sell at the local market in her village. the profits earned from this will allow her to help her husband meet the daily living expenses of the family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables

loans.name: Deggo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 23 Mars 2001. Il  est  constitué de 15 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.
Madame Maïmouna qui est à gauche de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est veuve et elle n'a pas d'enfants. Mais elle a en sa charge 02 enfants confié par des parents.
Elle s’active dans la vente de légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu’elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.
Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.
Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on the 23rd of March, 2001. It is made up of 15 women who live in the same district. Their main type of business activity is small retail.

Maïmouna, on the left of the photo, raising her hand, is the group's leader. She is 48 years old, widowed and has no children. She is, however, responsible for 2 children entrusted to her by relatives. She sells vegetables and has a good experience in this line of work, which she has been practicing for several years. This loan will enable her to strengthen her capital and better develop her business activities. The profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing, etc.) and to build up her savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Duo Blanca Nuevo Group

texts.es: Duo Blanca Nuevo: doña Blanca Estela de 29 años de edad tiene un hijo de 11 años,toda su familia como ella son comerciantes y le an enseñado a trabajar y luchar por sus sueños, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tipica en general y le da gracias a Dios porque la a vendecido,el credito lo esta solicitando para la compra de ropa tipica para la venta el sueño de ella es darle a su hijo lo nesesario y que mas adelante estudie y sea un profecional,espera en Dios que le puedan ayudar con este credito desde les desea Bendiciones. la siguiente soci se dedica a la venta de productos ocacionales.
texts.en:
Duo Blanca Nuevo: Blanca Estela is 29 years old and has an 11 year old son.  She and her whole family are merchants, and they have taught her to work and to fight for her dreams.  She sells traditional clothing in general and gives thanks to God for blessing her.  

The loan that she is requesting is to purchase typical clothing to sell.  It is her dream to give her son what is necessary so that later he can study and be a professional.  She hopes to God that this loan can help her with this, and she wishes blessings on those who help.  

The other partner sells products for special occasion.

loans.use: to purchase typical clothing

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Solidario El Rosario Group

texts.es: Solidario el Rosario. Alicia, de 51 años de edad ella tiene una tienda de productos comestibles de consumo diario y tambien vende almuersos desde hace 12 años, nos cuenta que nececita mas capital para trabajar ya que sus clientes tanto en la tienda como en las refacciones le esta pidiendo cada dia mas variedades en refacciones y productos comestibles,es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderias en productos comestibles y mercaderia para elavorar mas refacciones, esta muy contenta y agradecida con Dios por aberle dado la oportunidad de obtener este negocio ya que es una forma de ayudar a su familia,por lo tanto las otras dos integrantes nececitan el credito para la compra de mercaderia para la venta.
texts.en:
Solidario el Rosario 

Alicia is 51 years old and she has had a store that sells food products for everyday use where she has also sold lunches for 12 years. She tells us that she needs more capital to keep working since her customers, both those who buy groceries and those who buy lunches, ask every day for more variety in both meals and food products. 

This is why she asks for this loan, which she will use to buy more food products and products to make more meals. She is very happy and thanks God for having given her the opportunity to own this shop, as it is a way to help her family. 

The other two members of the group need this loan to buy products for resale as well.

loans.use: to buy everyday food products and ingredients to make lunches.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Duo Cristo Rey Group

texts.es: Duo Cristo Rey. Ingrid de 22 años ella se dedica a la elavoracion de tejidos tipicos desde hace 8 años nos cuenta que esta luchando para salir adelante dia a dia en con su negosio ya que por medio del negocio se a ayudado mucho,ella tege los tejidos tipicos que son del municipio ademas tege fajas que las señoras usan ára poder amarrarse el corte que usan, ella tege diariamente las blusas y fajas nos cuenta que a sabido organizar muy bien su tiempo porque por las mañanas teje blusas y por las tardes teje fajas ella entrega su producto en diferentes tiendas del municipio y le a ido muy bien,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la comfeccion de tejidos,tipicos. la siguiente socia se dedica a la venta de ropa Américana,
texts.en:
Duo Cristo Rey.  

Ingrid, age 22, has made a living making traditional fabrics for eight years.  She tells us that she is fighting to get ahead day to day with her business, because through her business she has helped herself greatly.  

She weaves the traditional fabrics of her town in addition to weaving the belts that women wear to tie the traditional skirts they wear.  She weaves the blouses and belts daily, and tells us that she knows how to organize her time well because in the morning she weaves the blouses and in the afternoons she weaves the belts.  She delivers her products to different shops in the town and she has done very well.  

She is asking for this loan in order to buy the raw materials for making traditional fabrics.  The other member of this group make a living selling American clothing.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making traditional fabrics.

loans.name: Duo Flor Chimalteca Group

texts.es: Duo Flor Chimalteca, Doña Magdalena de 42 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tipica desde hace 2 años nos cuenta que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa tipica ya que esta conciente de que le falta capital para trabajar porque sus clientes han umentado considerablemente el sueño de ella es tener un local donde ofrecer sus producto, al igual que el siguiente socio se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos.
texts.en: Of the group Duo Flor Chimalteca - Flower of Chimaltenango Duo - Magdalena is 42 years old and she has been making a living selling traditional clothing for the last 2 years. She shares she is requesting this loan to buy more traditional clothing since she is aware that she is lacking the capital to work with because her customers have increased considerably. Her dream is to have a business premise where she can offer her products, the same as  the group member next to her, he makes a living breeding and selling chickens.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Bakh  Yaye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Bakh Yaye a été crée depuis le premier cycle un du banc villageois et compte actuellement 7 membres. Il est composé des femmes habitants d'un même village et unis par des liens sociaux .

Madame Maguette est une femme mariée agée de 34 ans et mère de 3 enfants.

Maguette (debout à gauche de la photo habillé en robe bleu) est le responsable du dit groupe. Elle s'active dans le commerce par la vente de légumes depuis bientôt 5 ans. Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.

Son nouveau crédit de 200.000 XOF lui permettra de se procurer de la marchandise(salade, persil, tomate ...) 
Les bénéfices qu'elle réalise lui permettent d'épargner au niveau du banc villageois mais également de enforcer son activité.
texts.en:
The Bakh Yaye group was created after the first cycle of the "banc villageois" and currently has 7 members. It is made up of women who all live in the same village and are united by social bonds.

Maguette is 34 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She is standing on the left of the picture, wearing a blue dress, and is the group's leader. She has been selling vegetables for nearly 5 years. She has a good experience in this area. Her new loan of 200 000 francs will enable her to buy some merchandise (lettuce, parsley, tomatoes, etc.). The profits she makes allow her to save money with the "banc villageois" and also to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: And Liguey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité And liguey a été crée depuis le cycle un du banc villageois . Il est composé actuellement de 8 femmes qui habitent toutes le même village et se partagent de valeurs sociales communes. Leur activité principale se trouve être le petit commerce.

Sa responsable madame Déguéne (assise à l’extrême gauche de la photo avec une écharpe blanche sur la tête) est une femme mariée âgée de 65 ans et mère de 3 enfants et 2 autres qui lui sont confiés .

Elle développe une activité de petit commerce par la vente de denrées alimentaires.

Elle pratique cette activité depuis une bonne durée c'est pourquoi elle en dispose une bonne expérience.

Son nouveau prêt de 80.000 XOF lui permettra de s'approvisionner en huile riz poissons séchés et fumés 

qu'elle va revendre lors des marchés hebdomadaire des villages environnants.

Les bénéfices que génèrent sont activité lui permettent de payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants .
texts.en:
The And Liguey solidarity group was created during the first cycle of the "banc villageois". It is presently composed of 8 women who all live in the same village and share common social values. Their main business activity is small retail.

The group's leader, Déguéne (sitting on the far left of the photo with a white scarf on her head) is 65 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She is also taking care of 2 more who have been entrusted to her.

Déguéne is developing a small business selling food products. She has been in this line of work for a long time and is therefore experienced. Her new loan of 80 000 francs will enable her to buy oil, rice, dried and smoked fish, which she will resell at the local weekly markets in the surrounding villages. The profits generated by her business enable her to pay her children's educational expenses.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, dried and smoked fish.

loans.name: Karambenor Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 22 Mars 2001. Il  est  constitué de 15 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Mariama qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge 07 autres enfants confiés par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de bois de chauffe et d'huile de palme. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu’elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
The solidarity group was created on March 22, 2001. It is made up of 15 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main activity is small-scale retail.

Mariama, who is on the right-hand side of the photo with her hand raised, is the group leader. She is 51 years old. She is married and mother of eight children. She also has seven other children entrusted to her care by their parents.

She sells firewood and palm oil. She has plenty of experience in this field, which she has been involved in for several years.

This loan will allow her to increase her capital and better develop her business.

The profits will allow her to improve the living conditions of her family (health, food, clothing, etc.) and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy firewood and palm oil intended for resale

loans.name: Sope Serign Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sope serign Falou a été crée depuis le premier cycle du banc villageois il est composé actuellement de 10 membres .

Il regroupe des femmes habitant le même village partageant des valeurs sociales communes et s'activant toutes presque dans le petit commerce de légumes.

La responsable madame Astou (asise à l’extrême gauche de la photo avec un écharpe blanc sur la tête) Elle est une femme  marié et mère de 3 enfants et 2 autres qui lui sont confiés. Elle est âgée de 46 ans 

Elle s'active dans le petit commerce par la vente de légumes et fruits.

Elle dispose d'une expérience pour avoir mener cette activité depuis presque 7 ans .

Son nouveau crédit de 50.000 XOF lui permettra de se procurer de la marchandise( tomates 

,carrotes,choux,aubergines oranges mangues...)

Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettront d’épargner au niveau du banc villageois et renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
The Sope serign Falou group was created at the time of its first cycle with the "banc villageois." It currently has ten members.

It brings together women who live in the same village, share common social values, and almost all of whom are involved in the small-scale retail of vegetables.

Astou is the group leader (seated on the far left of the photo, with a white scarf on her head). She is married and mother of three children, as well as two others who have been entrusted to her care. She is 46 years old.

She works as a small-scale vendor of fruits and vegetables.

She has almost seven years of experience in this line of work.

Her new 50,000 XOF loan will allow her to stock up on goods for her business (tomatoes, carrots, cabbage, eggplants, oranges, mangos...)

The profits will allow her to have savings at the "banc villageois" and strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Sope Nabi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sope Nabi fondé depuis le premier cycle du Banc Villageois. Il est composé de 10 membres. Il regroupe des femmes habitants le même village et se partageant des valeurs sociales communes.

Sa responsable madame Gagnsiré (debout à l’extrême droite de la photo) est une femme mariée et mère de 6 enfants et 1 qui lui est confié. Elle est âgée de 45 ans 

Elle s'active dans le commerce par la confection et la vente de pagnes.

Elle mène cette activité depuis bientôt 12 ans c'est pourquoi elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce 

domaine.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'acheter des tissus pour la confection de pagnes qu'elle va revendre dans son village à ses camarades femmes membres du banc villageois.

Avec ses bénéfices elle parviens à aider son mari dans la gestion des dépenses journalières et dans l'achat 

de fournitures scolaires pour certains de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The Sope Nabi group has been in existence since the first cycle of the Banc Villageois.  It consists of 10 women who live in the same village and share common social values.
The representative of the group is Gagnsiré (standing at the far right in the photo).  She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children.  She also has an additional child in her care, entrusted to her.
She is actively involved in making and selling pagnes (colorful West African fabrics).  She has been working in this field for almost 12 years and therefore has a good experience in this activity.
Her new loan will allow her to buy fabrics to make pagnes.  She will resell her products in her village to fellow members of the Banc Villageois.  With her profits, she is able to help her husband manage daily expenses and buy school supplies for some of the children.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to make "pagnes".

loans.name: Takku Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Takku Liggey existe depuis le 14 décembre 2008, il est composé de six femmes qui sont des battantes d'où le nom donné au groupe.L'activité principale est le commerce.


Madame Fatou la responsable est âgée de 55 ans, mariée elle est mère de cinq enfants et s'active dans le commerce de friperie; elle capitalise une bonne expérience dans ce domaine. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en boubou multicolore avec un châle noir autour des épaules et a levé la main gauche. 


Elle achète et revend au marché central de la ville.


Son prêt lui servira à développer et diversifier son activité.



Elle se charge des besoins de sa famille surtout sur le plan scolaire et sanitaire.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Takku Liggey was created on December 14, 2008.  It consists of 6 women who are "fighters", hence the name given to the group.  Their main activity is retail business.
Fatou is the group's representative.  She is 55 years old, married, and the mother of 5 children.  She is actively involved in the trade of used clothing and has a good experience in this field.  She is standing to the right in the photo, raising her left hand, and she is wearing a multicolored boubou with a black shawl wrapped around her shoulders.
She buys and sells at the central market of the city.
Her loan will be used to develop and diversify her business.
Fatou takes care of her family's needs, specifically education and healthcare needs.

loans.use: to buy and resell used clothing.

loans.name: Sop Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Fallou existe depuis le 14 décembre 2008, il est composé de six femmes qui sont des voisines, elles se réunissent régulièrement afin de s'enquérir de leurs différents problèmes L'activité principale est le commerce.


Madame Diakhou la responsable est âgée de 45 ans, mariée elle est mère de sept enfants et s'active dans la restauration,elle capitalise une bonne expérience de douze ans. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en robe rouge avec un châle jaune autour des épaules et a levé la main gauche. 


Elle tient son restaurant tout près d'une boulangerie sur la route de l’hôpital régional.

Son prêt lui servira à développer son activité.


Elle souhaite avec ses bénéfices réaliser une épargne beaucoup plus consistante afin de pouvoir acheter une maison pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
The Sop Serigne Fallou solidarity group was founded on December 14, 2008. It is made up of six women who are neighbors. They meet regularly to ask after one another's various problems. Their main activity is commerce.

The leader, Diakhou, is 45 years old, married, and mother of seven children. She runs a restaurant, and has 12 years of experience. In the photo, she is standing on the right-hand side, with her left hand raised, wearing a red dress and a yellow shawl around her shoulders.

Her restaurant is located near a bakery, along the road leading to the regional hospital.

Her loan will help her to develop her business.

With her profits, she hopes to significantly increase her savings in order to be able to buy a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy condiments for their restaurant

loans.name: Ndiguel Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Ndiguel existe depuis le 14 décembre 2008, il est constitué de six femmes qui sont des voisines, elles ont un esprit d'entre aide. L'activité principale est le commerce.


Madame Awa la responsable est âgée de 43 ans, mariée elle est mère de trois enfants et s'active dans le         commerce de marchandises diverses,elle a une bonne expérience. Sur la photo elle est debout tout à fait à  droite habillée en robe bleue fleurettes avec des livrets à la main gauche. 


Elle achéte ses draps, chaussures et produits cosmétiques dans la capitale et revend dans son quartier et au marché central.

Son prêt lui servira à développer et diversifier son activité.


Elle souhaite avec ses bénéfices réaliser une épargne beaucoup plus consistante et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: The Ndiguel solidarity group has been in existence since December 14, 2008. It is composed of six women who are neighbors. They have a team spirit. Their main business activity is retail. Mrs. Awa, the group's leaser, is 43 years old, married and the mother of three. She sells diverse merchandise and has a long experience. On the photo she is standing on the far right wearing a blue outfit with a flower pattern and holding their savings books in her left hand. She buys linen, shoes and cosmetic products in the capital and resells these wares in her neigborhood and at the central market. Her loan will allow her to diversify and grow her business. With her revenues, she would like to maintain a consistent level of savings and provide for her family's naeeds.

loans.use: to buy diverse merchandise for resale

loans.name: Gorgorlou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 23 Mars 2001. Il  est  constitué de 15 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.
Madame Elisabeth qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 65 ans. Elle est mariée et sans enfants. Mais, elle a en sa charge 06 enfants confiés par ses parents.
Elle s’active dans la vente de fruits. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu’elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.
Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.
Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This group was established on March 23, 2001. It is made up of 15 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main business is retail. 

Mrs. Elisabeth, raising her hand in the photograph, is responsible for the group. She's 65 years old, married, and without children. But she has six children to support, entrusted to her by family members.

She sells fruits, and has a good experience in this field, since she's been running this business for several years.

This loan will enable her to bolster her working capital and better develop her activities.

The profits will enable her to improve her family's standard of living (healthcare, food, clothes, etc…) and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy and resell fruits

loans.name: Daara-Ji Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 23 Mars 2001. Il  est  constitué de 12 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.
Madame Ramatoulaye qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 49 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. 
Elle s’active dans la vente de petit commerce. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu’elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.
Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.
Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This group was established on March 23, 2001. It is made up of twelve women whole live in the same neighborhood. Their main business is retail.

Mrs. Ramatoulaye, raising her hand in the photograph, is responsible for the group. She's 49 years old, married, and the mother of one child.

She's a retailer, and has a good experience in this field, since she's been running this business for several years.

This loan will enable her to bolster her working capital and better develop her business.

The profits will enable her to improve the standard of living of the family (healthcare, food, clothing, etc.) and increase her saving.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cereals to retail

loans.name: Batiyaye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 22 Mars 2001. Il  est  constitué de 15 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.
Madame Fatoumata qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 44 ans. Elle est célibataire et mère de 02 enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge 02 autres enfants confiés par ses parents.
Elle s’active dans la vente de poissons. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu’elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.
Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.
Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This group was established on March 22, 2001. It is made up of fifteen women from the same neighborhood. Their main business is retail.

Mrs. Fatoumata, raising her hand in the photograph, is responsible for the group. She's 44 years old, unmarried, and the mother of two children. She also has two other children to support, who were entrusted to her by parents.

She sells fish, and has a good experience in this field, since she's been running this business for several years.

This loan will enable her to bolster her working capital and better develop her business.

The profits will enable her to improve her family's standard of living (healthcare, food, clothing, etc.) and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy fish to retail

loans.name: Dioubo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 23 Mars 2001. Il  est  constitué de 15 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Fatoumata qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est divorcée et mère d'un enfant. 

Elle s’active dans la vente de légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu’elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en: This solidarity group has been created on March 23, 2001. It is composed of 15 women living in the same neighborhood. The main business activity is retail. Mrs. Fatoumata, standing on the right [sic!] and raising her hand in the photo, is the group’s leader. She is 40 years old. She is divorced, with one child. She sells vegetables. She has a long experience, having done this line of work for a number of years. This loan will allow her to bolster her capital and better grow her business. The revenues will allow her to improve the life conditions of her family (healthcare, food, clothing etc) and build up her savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale

loans.name: Sop Sergne Bara Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Bara a été crée le 14décembre 2008. Il est composé de 08 femmes issues de la même localité. Elles  se sont réunies par affinité et par des liens de voisinage. Elles exercent la même activité, le petit commerce.Arame,debout à droite sur la photo et a la main levée, est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 56 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants.Elle fait le petit commerce de fruits et légumes.Elle fait aussi un petit commerce de tissus.Avec son prêt reçu,elle veut augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement en fruits,légumes et tissus pour revendre 
Ses bénéfices lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de la famille,mais aussi renforcer son épargne dans le banc villageois.un membre est absent sur la photo
texts.en:
The Sop Serigne Bara solidarity group has been created on December 15, 2008. IT is composed of eight women living in the same neighborhood and belonging to the same “dahira” (African association). They are friends and neighbors who decided to form a group together. They all work as vendors.
Arame, standing on the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the group’s leader. She is 56 years old, married and the mother of seven. She sells fruits, vegetables and cloth. With her loan, she is going to  expand her stock level of fruits, vegetables and cloth to resell. He income will allow her to provider for her family and household needs and also add to her savings at the “banc villageois.”

loans.use: ACHAT DE FRUITS ET LEGUMES ET DES TISSUS;

loans.name: Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Mame Diarra existe depuis le 9 décembre 2010, il est composé de 26 femmes qui habitent le même quartier et sont parentes et amies. Le petit commerce est leur principale activité.


La responsable madame Codou est âgée de 40 ans, elle est mariée mère de quatre enfants; elle mène une activité de petit commerce de marchandises diverses et de petit déjeuner, elle a une bonne expérience. Elle est debout à droite tout à fait à l'extrême habillée en boubou bleu et couverte d'un châle orange.


Elle vend le petit déjeuner à l'école élémentaire et au collège de sa localité pendant l'année scolaire; et achète des tissus et divers articles qu'elle revend dans son quartier pendant les vacances.


Son prêt lui servira à acheter plus de marchandises et de condiments qu'elle utilise pour le petit déjeuner afin de se faire beaucoup de revenus.


Elle appui son mari dans la gestion quotidienne des dépenses de la famille et souhaite devenir une grande commerçante.
texts.en:
The Mame Diarra solidarity group was founded on December 9, 2010. It is made up of 26 women who are relatives and friends living in the same neighborhood. Small-scale retail is their main activity.

The group leader, Codou, is 40 years old. She is married and mother of four children. She has a small business selling various goods and breakfast. She has a lot of experience. She is standing on the far right-hand side of the photo, dressed in a blue boubou and an orange shawl.

During the school year, she sells breakfast to the elementary school and to the middle school in her village. During vacation, she buys fabrics and various items which she resells in her neighborhood.

She will use her loan to buy more goods and condiments for making breakfast in order to generate lots of income.

She supports her husband in the daily management of family expenses and hopes to become a great merchant.

loans.use: to buy goods and condiments for selling breakfast

loans.name: Sop Mouhamed Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Mouhamed a été créé le 14 décembre 2008; il est constitué de dix femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Les activités menées sont le petit commerce, la couture et l'élevage.

La responsable Couna est âgée de 38 ans, elle est mariée mère de deux enfants et a en charge ses deux nièces. 

Elle tient une boutique d'alimentation générale en collaboration avec son frère où elle vend du riz, de l'huile du sucre du  mil etc. Elle a une bonne expérience de très longue date car elle a toujours mené cette activité. Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en boubou jaune avec un châle de la même couleur sur les épaules.

Elle s'approvisionne au marché central de la ville et revend dans sa boutique.

Son prêt lui servira à renforcer son commerce afin de gagner plus de revenus.

Ayant son mari et sa mère malades, elle a en charge leurs soins médicaux raison pour laquelle elle travaille avec son frère. Elle soutient également ses enfants dans leur scolarité et formation.
texts.en:
The Sop Mouhamed solidarity group was created on December 14th, 2008; it comprises ten women living in the same neighbourhood.  They are running businesses in retail, clothing, and raising [of livestock].

The representative of the group, Couna, is 38 years old.  She is married and has two children, she also has her two nieces as dependents.

She runs a general food store in collaboration with her brother. They sell rice, sugar, oil, millet, etc.  She has a high level of experience, since she has always run this business.  She is standing to the right of the photo, dressed in a yellow boubou with a shall of the same color on her shoulders.

She stocks up at the central market of the town, and resells from a boutique.

This loan will allow her to strengthen her business and generate more profit.

Having her husband and mother both ill, she also bears the responsibility of their medical care, which is why she works with her brother. At the same time, she supports her children and their education and training.

loans.use: to purchase food products for resale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia lives in Kator. She has a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 35 year old, married and has six children – five of them are still in school. Cecilia heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 4,000 SDG in order to purchase beans, maize. She will use her extra income to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans and maize for sale.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 28-year-old married man from Baqa'a, Jordan and a father of two children. 

Mohammad makes pottery and he is requesting a loan of 400 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to purchase materials needed in making pottery. Because Mohammad is under 30 years old his loan considered a youth loan. 

Mohammad hopes to purchase a shop for his business and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed in making pottery

loans.name: Nadeen

texts.en:
Nadeen is a 20-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of one child.

Nadeen has a micro retail business; she sells goods such as clothes and blankets from her home and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase more quantities. Because she is under 30 years old, her loan is considered as a youth loan.

Nadeen is looking to establish a shop for her business and purchase a home instead of her current rented one.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as clothes and blankets for business purposes

loans.name: Apple Grace Tomas

texts.en:
Apple Grace is 24 years old and married. For the past five years she has run a sari-sari, or retail shop. She usually earns about 300 PHP a day. 

Apple Grace is now requesting a 12,000 PHP loan from ASKI to buy eggs, vegetable oil, chips, assorted biscuits and soft drinks to sell in her sari-sari. She hopes that she qualifies for the amount she is requesting so she can further improve her shop.

loans.use: to buy eggs, vegetable oil, chips, assorted biscuits and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Zone Permata Group

texts.en:
Farida is 53 years old. She is a widow. She lives with her  three children; one has finished school and found a job and the two others are still attending school at elementary and junior high school. Since her husband passed away, she is dedicated to the care of her children, giving them love, education and food. She has been selling vegetables for the last 12 years. She sells them in front of her house and door-to-door around her neighborhood. This business allows her to develop herself so as to be independent, dynamic and active. Her business is going well and because of this business she can pay her family expenses and pay her children's school fees. 

Farida requested the loan to add more vegetables to sell such as cabbage, spinach, and sprouts. In the future she wants to have a large stall to sell her vegetables and have enough saving to send her children to get a very good education. 

Other group members will use their loans to improve their businesses such as selling fruit, selling clothes and electronics servicing.

loans.use: to pay for more cabbage, spinach, and sprouts to sell

loans.name: Santina

texts.en:
Santina lives in Kator. She sells charcoal and has been in business for five years. She is 37 year old, married, and has six children -- all of them are still in school. 

Santina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG 500 in order to purchase charcoal.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in Kator. She operates a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 31 years old, married, and has four children, all of them are still in school. 

Elizabeth heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of SDG 500 in order to purchase beans and maize flour. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: buy beans and maize flour

loans.name: Rahama

texts.en:
Rahama lives in Kator. She runs a food stall and has been in business for two years. She is 40 years old, married, and has four children -- three of them are still in school. 

Rahama heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC.  Rahama has requested a loan of SDG 500 in order to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: buy beans and onions

loans.name: Sainte Famille Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sainte Famille a été crée en 2008. Il est composé de 10 femmes issues de la même localité. Elles exercent la même activité qui est le commerce.		
Debout à droite de la photo, Thérèse la responsable du groupe  est âgée de 49 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants.Elle à en charge des neveux et des nièces.
Elle développe une activité de petit commerce de pagnes et d'habits dans sa localité		
Avec son prêt reçu, elle va acheter des habits et des pagnes pour les revendre dans son quartier et environs et à ses camarades de Banc Villageois.		
Ses recettes lui permettront d'assurer la scolarité de ses enfants, elle compte aussi construire sa maison.
texts.en:
Saint Famille Group was established in 2008. It is made up of ten women from the same village who run the same business, retail.

Thèrese is responsible for the group. She's standing on the right in the photograph. She's 49 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She has nephews and nieces in her care.

She runs a small business selling pagnes (colorful African cloth) and clothes in her village.

With her part of the loan, she will buy clothes and pagnes, and resell them in her neighborhood and its surroundings, as well as to her friends at the Banc Villageois.

Her revenue will enable her to ensure her children can go to school. She also intends to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy clothes and "pagnes" (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Bokk Xol Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité bokk xol a été crée le 08 Mars 2012. Il est composé de 13 femmes habitant le même quartier et exerçant la même activité qu'est le petit commerce.

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, la responsable est âgée de 65 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants. 

Avec ce prêt, elle va acheter du jus de citron et de l'huile de palme pour son commerce. 

Les bénéfices générés lui permettront d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa progéniture .
texts.en:
Bokk Xol Group was established on March 8, 2012. It is made up of 13 women who live in the same neighborhood and run the same business, retail.

The woman responsible for the group is standing on the right in the photograph, raising her hand. She's 65 years old, married, and the mother of eight children.

With this loan, she will buy lemon juice and palm oil for her business. Her profits will enable her to improve the standard of living of her children.

loans.use: to buy lemon juice and palm oil

loans.name: St Francois D'assise Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est composé de 9 femme, il a été crée depuis l'ouverture du Banc Villageois. Les 09 membres qui la composent habitent dans la même ville et font comme activité principale le commerce.

La responsable, Catherine, est âgée de 52 ans. Elle est debout à droite de la photo et levant la main. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants, elle en charge aussi son beau fils.

Son prêt lui permet d'acheter les produits nécessaires à savoir du bissap, du pain de singe, du sucre pour faire de la crème glacée.

Ses recettes lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille tout en augmentant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of nine women. It was established when the Banc Villageois opened. The nine members of the group all live in the same town and their main business is retail.

Catherine, age 52, is responsible for the group. She's standing on the right in the photograph, raising her hand. She's married and the mother of three children. She also has her step son in her care.

Her part of the loan will enable her to buy products she needs to make ice-cream, namely hibiscus, monkey's bread (baobab tree fruit), and sugar.

Her revenue will enable her to improve the standard of living of her family and bolster her savings.

loans.use: to buy products she needs to make ice-cream

loans.name: Rew Kertienne Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Rew Kertienne a été crée depuis l'ouverture du Banc Villageois. Il compte 11 femmes toutes issues de la même localité et exerçant la même activité qui est le commerce et l'élevage. 

Madame Odette, debout à l'extrême droite de la photo et mise en médaillon est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 44 ans. Elle est célibataire sans enfant mais elle a en charge sa nièce et une de ses sœur.
		
Son prêt reçu lui permettra d'acheter les denrées alimentaires nécessaire (riz huile et condiments) pour le restaurant qu'elle gère. 

En effet elle prépare le repas de midi et le diner. Elle est très expérimentée dans la restauration pour l'avoir menée pendant plusieurs années.Ses clientes apprécient bien ce qu'elle fait. Elle fait aussi l’élevage de poulets de chairs.	
	
Les bénéfices générés vont lui permettre d'améliorer ses conditions de vie et d’assurer une bonne éducation à ses protégées.
texts.en:
Rew Kertienne Group was established when the Banc Villageois opened. It is made up of 11 women coming from the same village and running the same businesses, retail and raising livestock.

Mrs. Odette, standing on the right in the photograph and shown in the inset, is responsible for the group. She's 44 years old, single and without children, but she has her niece and one of her sisters to support.

Her loan will enable her to buy food products (rice, oil and condiments) she needs for the restaurant she runs. She prepares lunch and dinner.

She has a lot of experience in food serving, since she's been running this business for several years. Her customers appreciate the food she prepares. She also raises chicken.

Her profits will enable her to improve her standard of living and ensure the children she has in her care get a good education.

loans.use: to buy food products for her restaurant, as well as chicks

loans.name: Sainte Rita Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé depuis l'ouverture du Banc Villageois. IL est composé de 11 membres issus pour la plupart du même quartier et font comme activité principale le commerce. 

La responsable Marie Jeanne est âgée de 58 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants, elle a aussi en en charge des petits enfants.
	
Elle fait comme activité le commerce, elle vend du jus de citron, des balais et des cacahouétes. Elle a une bonne expérience de cette activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plusieurs années

Son prêt lui permet d'acheter ses produits à vendre et avec les bénéfices générés elle prend en charge ses enfants et leur assure leur scolarité.
texts.en:
This group was created at the inauguration of the local Banc Villageois. It consists of 11 members mostly from the same neighborhood whose main activity is small trade. 

The head of the group is Marie Jeanne, age 58. She is married with seven children. She also looks after some of her grandchildren. 

She is a merchant who sells lemon juice, brooms and groundnuts. With several years of experience to her credit, she now has a good command of her activity. 

This loan will allow her to stock up on merchandise to sell. She will use the profits earned to take care of her children and provide for their education.

loans.use: to buy ground nuts, brooms and lemon juice for resale.

loans.name: Takku  Liguey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité takku ligguey a été créé le 08 Mars 2012. Il est composé de 14 femmes toutes habitant le même quartier et menant la même activité qu'est le petit commerce. 

Madame Mame, Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est responsable du groupe. Elle est agée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants. 

Elle développe un petit commerce de légumes et de poissons. Elle a une expérience avérée dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plusieurs années. 

Avec le prêt reçu elle va acheter des légumes et du poisson qu'elle revend au marché de sa localité.

Les bénéfices générés par son activité lui permettront d'assurer une meilleure amélioration de la condition de vie de sa progéniture.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Takku Ligguey was created March 8 2012. It consists of 14 women from the same neighborhood whose main activity is small trade. 

The head of the group is Mrs. Mame, standing at the right of the photo with her hand raised. She is 43 years old, married and the mother of 8 children.  

She runs a small business selling vegetables and fish. With several years of experience in this sector, she now has a good command of her activity.  

She will use her loan to buy vegetables and fish for resale at the local market. 

The profits earned through this activity will allow her to improve her children’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fish and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Rose Madeleine Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Rose Madeleine a été crée depuis 2008, il est composé de 15 femmes qui font presque la même activité.
La responsable Élisabeth debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 60 ans.Elle est mariée et mère de 01 enfant, à en charge aussi des nièces, des neveux et des petits fils.
Elle fait comme activité le commerce, elle vend des jus de bissap , de pain de singe et aussi de la glace.Elle expérimenté pour l'avoir fait de tout temps.
Son prêt lui permet d'acheter les ingrédients nécessaires pour la production du jus.
Avec les recettes de son activité elle compte acheter un terrain pour construire sa propre maison. Elle veut améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Created in 2008, the solidarity group Rose Madeleine consists of 15 women, most of whom practice the same activity. The head of the group is Élisabeth, standing at the right in the photo, with her hand raised. She is 60 years old, married and the mother of one child. She also looks after some of her nieces, nephews and grandsons.

Elisabeth sells bissap juice (made from dried hibiscus), pain de singe (baobab fruit) and ice. With her experience, she has a good command of her activity. 

This loan will allow her to buy the ingredients needed to make bissap juice. She plans to use the income earned from this activity to buy some land and build her own house. She wants to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sugar, bissap, pain de singe, etc.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 25-year-old single man from Al Zarqa, Amman; Jordan.

Mohammad is selling fruits and vegetables and he is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase more quantities for trading purposes. 

Because Mohammad is under 30 years old, his loan is considered as a youth loan.

Mohammad is looking to expand his business and participate in the social security program.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Leena

texts.en:
Leena is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The woman in the photo is her mother-in-law.

Leena is a 22-year-old married woman from Idon, Irbid, Jordan.

Leena sells clothes and works from her home. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase more quantities of clothes for business purposes. Because Leena is under 30 years old, her loan considered as a youth loan.

Leena is looking to expand her project.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for business purposes

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en:
Taghreed is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The man in the photo is her husband.

Taghreed is a 37-year-old married woman from Baqa'a, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Taghreed has a home-based business: she sells clothes and is requesting a loan of 1200 JD to purchase more quantities for business purposes.

Taghreed is looking to expand her business and thus increase her sales volume so that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for business purposes

loans.name: Sop Serigne Touba Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe Sop Serigne Touba a été créé le 30 décembre 2009.IL est composé de 16 femmes issues d'un même village. Elles se sont organisées par affinité, par des liens de parenté. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce et l'élevage. 

Khayta(debout à droite sur la photo habillé en vert) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 23ans. Elle a en charge 01 enfant. 

Elle a comme activité principale le petit commerce de fruits et légumes. En parallèle elle fait de l'embouche Ovine. Elle mène cette d'activité depuis 02 ans. 

Son prêt va lui permettre d'acheter la marchandise (fruits et légumes) et un mouton. 

Son objectif est d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
The Sop Serigne Touba group was created on December 30, 2009.  It consists of 16 women from the same village.  They came together as a group because they were friends or relatives.  Their main activity is small retail business and animal husbandry.

Khayta (standing at the far right in the photo and dressed in green) is the representative of the group.  She is 23 years old and has one child in her care.

Her main activity is small retail business: she sells fruits and vegetables.  She also fattens up sheep.  She has been involved in this activity for the past 2 years.

With this loan, she will be able to buy some fruits and vegetables, as well as one sheep.

Her goal is to improve her family's living conditions and to strengthen her savings.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables, and one sheep.

loans.name: Sope El Hadji Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de solidarité Sop El Hadji Malick est créé le 30/12/2009, il regroupe 13 femmes qui se sont unies par des liens d'amitié et habitent le même village, elles mènent diverses activités le petit commerce, l'artisanat et l'élevage. Diogo la responsable est âgée de 62 ans, mariée elle est mère de 07 enfants dont 02 en charge, elle fait de l'agriculture et mène aussi une activité de petit commerce de légumes, elle a une expérience de plus de 06 ans.Elle est debout tout à fait à droite sur la photo habillée en ensemble pagne fleurette vert. Elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés environnants et revend dans son village. Son prêt lui servira d'acheter des moutons, de la marchandise afin de gagner beaucoup de revenus. Elle souhaite avec ses bénéfices prendre en charge ses enfants et augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
Solidarity group Sop El Hadji Malick was created on 12/30/2009. It is comprised of thirteen women who are bound by friendship and live in the same village. They run several businesses in retail, crafts, and animal husbandry.
Diogo, the group’s leader, is 62 years old. She is married and a mother of seven; two of her children are still financial dependents. She farms and retails vegetables, and has over six years of experience doing so. She is standing all the way to the right in the picture, wearing a green flowery outfit.
Diogo gets her supplies from neighboring markets and retails in her village. Her loan will be used to purchase sheep and merchandise, to earn large revenues. With the profit, she wishes to take care of her children and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and vegetables.

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en:
Kamel is a 25-year-old married man from Al Khaledieh, Al Mafraq, Jordan. He is a father of one child.

Kamel is a proud owner of a grocery store. He is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase fruits and vegetables for his store.

Because Kamel is under 30 years old, his loan considered a youth loan.

Kamel is looking to expand his business and improve his family's life conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for his store.

loans.name: Maryana

texts.en:
Maryana is a 20-year-old single woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Maryana is an ambitious woman. She wants to continue her college study despite her bad financial condition.

Maryana is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to cover part of her college expenses.

Because Maryana is under 30 years old, her loan considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to cover her college expenses.

loans.name: Freydis Noel

texts.es: Freydis es un joven bachiller de 24 años de edad,  soltero,  es originario del municipio de Somoto-Estelí. Desde hace 1 año se dedica al comercio específicamente en  el negocio de alquiler de videos juegos. Inicio sus actividades a los 23 años de edad en ese momento solo tenía  un televisor y un nintendo play station 2, actualmente cuenta con dos televisores y dos play  station que fueron donados por su padre que vive en el extranjero. Freydis es de los pocos comerciantes que tiene este tipo de negocio en su comunidad ya que no es común encontrar un lugar de videos juegos donde la mayoría de los niños se distraigan. Tiene como expectativas ampliar el numero de play station y televisores para cubrir la demanda de ese negocio en su comunidad, el desea un préstamo para la compra de un play station y un televisor de 21 pulgadas el considera que este le ayudara a crecer su negocio porque podrá cubrir la demanda de su nintenderia y obtendrá mas ganancias para seguir ampliando su negocio.
texts.en: Freydis is a young high school graduate, single, 24 years old and originally from the municipality of Somoto-Estelí. For the last year he has been working in commerce, specifically, he has been in the videogame renting business. He started his business when he was 23. At the time he only had a television and a PlayStation 2 console. Currently, he has two televisions and two PlayStations that were donated by his father who lives abroad. Freydis is one of the few salespeople with a business of this type in his community, since it is not easy to find a video game place where most children can entertain themselves. He expects to increase the number of PlayStations and televisions so that he can meet the demand that there is in his community. He would like a loan to buy another PlayStation and a 21 inch television that he think will help him meet the demand he is getting in his video gaming center and will increase his profit that will be used to keep expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy a television and a PlayStation for his entertainment business.

loans.name: Sope Serigneibra Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité a été créé le 30/12/2009.IL est composé de 12 femmes issues du même village. Elles se sont organisées par des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce et la transformation de produits céréaliers. 

Madame SENEBA(debout à droite sur la photo habillée en mauve avec écharpe rouge) est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 52 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 06 enfants dont 01 qui lui a été confié par des proches. 

Elle a comme activité principale le petit commerce de café,de sucre, et de condiments(piments,poivre,ail). Elle mène cette d'activité depuis 05 ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans les villages environnants. 

Son prêt va lui permettre d'acheter de la marchandise pour bien mener ses activités et satisfaire sa clientèle. 

Son objectif est de prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille et de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on 12/30/2009. It is comprised of twelve women from the same village. They got organized through neighborly and friendship relations. Their main activities are retail and the transformation of grain. 

Mrs. Seneba (standing on the right in the picture, wearing purple with a red scarf) is the group leader. She is 52 years old. She is a widow and a mother of six; one of `the children was entrusted in her care by relatives.

Her main business is the retail of coffee, sugar and condiments (chili peppers, black pepper, and garlic). She has been in this business for five years. She procures her supplies from neighboring villages. Her loan will allow her to purchase merchandise with which to carry on her business and to satisfy her clientele.

Her objective is to provide for her family and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase coffee and condiments (chili pepper, black pepper, sugar).

loans.name: Takku Liggey Group

texts.fr:
le groupe Tàkku Liggey a été créé le 09 Août 2011.IL est composé de 11femmes issues du même village. Elles se sont organisées par affinité, par des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce de l'élevage,la transformation d'arachide et font de l'agriculture. 

Yacine(debout à droite sur la photo a levé sa main droite) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 52 ans. Elle est veuve et a en charge 04 enfants. 

Elle a comme activité principale le petit commerce de fruits et légumes, elle fait aussi de la transformation d'huile d'arachide. Elle mène cette d'activité depuis 05 ans. 

Son prêt va lui permettre d'acheter des légumes et des arachides pour satisfaire sa clientèle. 

Son objectif est de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et de renforcer son épargne dans le banc villageois.
texts.en:
Group Tàkku Liggey was created on April 9, 2011. It comprises eleven women from the same village. They got together by affinity, through family and neighborly relations. Their main activities are retail, animal husbandry, and ground nut processing; they also farm.

Yacine (standing to the right in the picture with her hand raised) is the group leader. She is 52 years old. She is widowed and has four children in her care.

Her main activity is the retail of fruits and vegetables; she also processes ground nuts into oil. She has been in this business for five years.

Her loan will allow her to purchase vegetables and ground nuts to meet demand. Her objective is to provide for her family and to increase her savings in the village finance group.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and ground nuts to process.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in Yambio. She sells food at a food stall, and has been in business for 3 years. She is 33 years old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school.
 
Alice heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her  fifth from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 3000 SDG in order to purchase onions and rice. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions and rice for sale.

loans.name: Khadim Rassoul Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Khadim Rassoul existe depuis le 9 décembre 2010, il est composé de treize femmes qui sont parentes et amies; leurs activités principales sont le petit commerce et l'embouche ovine.


Madame Penda la responsable est âgée de 42 ans, elle est mariée mère de deux enfants et a la charge de six autres personnes. Elle vend des denrées alimentaires ( riz, huile, mil, sucre.....)depuis 13 ans et capitalise une bonne expérience. Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en bleu-rose.

Elle compte avec son prêt renforcer son commerce afin d'espérer plus de revenus.


Elle souhaite à l'avenir réaliser beaucoup de choses à savoir acheter une maison pour ses enfants et élargir son commerce.
texts.en:
The Khadim Rassoul solidarity group has been in existence since December 9, 2010. It is composed of 13 women who are relatives and friends. Their main business activities are vending and raising sheep.

Mrs. Penda, the group’s leader, is 42 years old. She is married, with two children, and six other dependents.  She has been selling staple foods (rice, oil, millet, sugar etc) for 13 years, and has a lot of experience. In the photo, she is standing on the right wearing a blue and pink outfit.
She plans to user her loan to strengthen her business in the hope of increasing her revenues. In the future she would like to be able to earn enough to buy a house for her children, as well as to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy staple foods for resale.

loans.name: Fatimah

texts.en:
Fatimah is a 24-year-old woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan.

Fatimah is looking to improve her family's living conditions so she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to do maintenance on her house.

Because Fatimah is under 30 years, old her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to do maintenance for her home

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en:
Suzan is a 26-year-old married woman from Al Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan and a mother of two children.

Suzan is selling clothes and she is working from her home.

Suzan is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase clothes for business purposes, and because she is under 30 years old, her loan considered a youth loan.

Suzan is looking to improve her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for business purposes

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
Hanaa is a 29-year-old married woman from Irbid, Jordan and a mother of two children.

Hanaa is selling cosmetics and she is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase more quantities for business purposes. She is looking to improve her business and increase her family's living standards.

Because Hanaa is under 30 years old, her loan is considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
El señor Emilio esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materia prima para el negocio de elaboración y venta de tamales. Le esta haciendo falta comprar masa, carne, y varios ingredientes, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar esta inversión ya que tiene varios pedidos para entregar, en eventos sociales que son piñatas y fiesta. 
Desea invertir en su negocio ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para salir adelante. 
Don Emilio ya ha tenido crédito con KIVA el cual lo utilizo para invertir en su negocio, es pero contar con su cooperación en este préstamo que se utilizara para el negocio tenga más productividad y mayor ingreso.
texts.en:
Emilio is seeking a loan to buy ingredients for his business of making and selling tamales. He needs to buy the dough, meat, and several ingredients, but he doesn't have the money he needs to make this investment as he has several orders to be delivered for social events which are piñatas and parties. He wants to invest in his business as it is the source of income he has to get ahead.

Emilio has already had a loan from Kiva which he used to invest in his business. He hopes to count on your help for this loan which he will use to make his business more productive and generate a bigger income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to sell tamales

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina lives in Yambio. She sells clothes, and has been in business for five years. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children; all of them are still in school. 

Angelina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer; this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 900 Sudanese Pounds (SDG) in order to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Dana

texts.en:
Dana is a conservative person. She is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet, so the man in the photo is her father, Mohammad.

Dana is a 20-year-old woman from Al Salt, Al Balqa, Jordan. She has a roastery and is requesting a loan of 1,000 JD to purchase goods needed for her roastery such as coffee beans, nuts, etc.
 
Because Dana is under 30 years old, her loan is considered as a youth loan.

Dana is looking to improve her business and increase her sales volume.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her roastery (coffee beans, nuts, etc)

loans.name: Pedro Vicente Rodas Beltran

texts.es: Pedro de 44 años vive ( libertad ecuador ). El comenzó este negocio hace 4  años atrás imitando la comida colombiana. Trabaja todos los días con mucho esfuerzo y ganas junto a su esposa (Aparece en la foto). A futuro el desea que sus hijos sean profesionales y que tengan una vida saludable. Con el préstamo comprara ( Bebidas, carnes).
texts.en: Pedro, 44, lives in Libertad, Ecuador.  He started this business four years ago imitating Colombian food.  He works every day with much effort and dedication alongside his wife (she appears in the photo).  In future, he’d like his children to become professionals and have a healthy life.  He will use the loan to buy beverages and meat.

loans.use: to buy beverages and meat.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice lives in Yei.  She is 30 years old, married and has three children who are still in school.  She sells food in a food stall and has been in business for two years. 

Joice heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan request from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase tomatoes and onions.  She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Alexei Prihodko

texts.ru: Алексей торгует на рынке обувью. Недавно была рынком была сделана реконструкция торгового места Алексея. Теперь Алексей сможет торговать в любую погоду и не пользоваться грузчиками и складом как раньше. Алексею пришлось потратить 10,000 грн на реконструкцию. Деньги взял из бизнеса.  Теперь Алексею нужно пополнить обороные стедства, чтобы приобрести весеннюю мужскую овувь для нового торгового места. Алексей проживает с женой и взослыми детьми.
texts.en: Alexei sells shoes at the market. Recently, the market's direction has renovated Alexei's retail outlet, and he now can continue his trade in any weather and does not need to use a warehouse or rely on porters as previously. Alexei had to spend 10,000 hryvnia for the renovations - money he took out of his business. Now he needs to replenish his working capital in order to purchase men's spring footwear for his brand new shop. Alexei lives with his wife and adult children.

loans.use: to purchase spring footwear

loans.name: Anna

texts.ru:
В прошлый раз Анна использовала кредит для закупки товара по оптовым ценам. Зима была холодная и товар продовался хорошо. Анна смогла получить хорошую прибыль и улучшить свои жилищные условия.

В этот раз Анна просит предоставить ей кредит на закупку весеннего товара - шапки, детские костюмчики и комплекты одежды. Анна торгует детским товаром уже четыре года и планирует развивать свой бизнес дальше.
texts.en:
Using her last loan, Anna purchased new merchandise at wholesale prices. The winter was cold and the goods sold well. Anna was able to make a profit and improve her living conditions. 

This time, Anna is requesting a loan to purchase spring merchandise - hats, children's clothing and outfits. Anna has been selling children's goods for four years and plans to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase spring merchandise

loans.name: Abakoranabushake /kmnm/sk Group

texts.fr:
François fait partie du groupe Abakoranabushake/Kmnm/Sk. Il a 30 ans et il est célibataire. Il a 2 personnes dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 5 ans de primaire.

François est agriculteur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter, des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utilise des semences de race améliore. Dans les prochaines années, François voudrait être un grand agriculteur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit  de payer le frais scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Francois is a member of the Abakoranabushake/Kmnm/Sk group.  He is 30 years old and single.  He takes care of two people in addition to his children.  He has had five years of primary school. 

Francois is a rice farmer.  This is his first loan with ACB.  He is going to use the loan to buy fertilizers and to pay his labor. 

His strategy for growing his business is to use improved seeds.  In the years to come, Francois would like to be a successful farmer in his region.  With his profits, he foresees being able to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay his labor.

loans.name: Alexander Gavrilov

texts.ru:
Александр с супругой и двумя маленькими дочерьми живет в Тарасовке, Херсонская область. Он выращивает ранние культуры на 90 сотках в теплицах под дугами, агроволокном, а также на открытом грунте: 800 кустов клубники, 150 кустов 6 ранних сортов винограда, 20 тонн моркови, 1 тонну свеклы, 10 тонн лука и 2 тонны сельдерея. Сельским хозяйством Александр занимается уже 6 лет. В этот бизнес он вложил около 50 000 гривен. Чистая средняя прибыль составляет около 6 500 гривен.   

Александр планирует подготовиться к весеннему сезону в тепличном бизнесе и для этого обратился в КИВА за дополнительной финансовой помощью. Кредит в 15 000 гривен он планирует распределить следующим образом: купить семена на 5 000 гривен, пленку на 2 000 гривен, удобрения на 2 500 гривен, агроволокно на 2 500 гривен, а также капельный шланг на 3 000 гривен. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Alexander, his wife, and their two young children live in Tarasovka, Kherson oblast. He grows early season crops on 9000 square meters in greenhouses under hoops, cloth row cover, and also on open ground. He has 800 strawberry plants, 150 grape plants of 6 varieties, 20 tons of carrots, 1 ton of beets, 10 tons of onions, and 2 tons celery. Alexander has been farming for 6 years. He has invested 50,000 hryvnia in his business. His average net income is around 6,500 hryvnia.
